5:30.race_name: Dundalk Stadium Group Deals Available Apprentice Optional Claiming Race

runners.name: El Bello
runners.comment: Seems to have lost his way since May 2024 and hard to fancy off joint-top weight
runners.spotlight: Seems to have lost his way since finishing runner-up in a claimer in May 2024 and hard to fancy off joint-top weight here.

quotes.race: Bet On The Best Night Out At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: El Bello was tough all the way to the line. Two horses came alongside him and he battled well. You'd like to think he could get an extra furlong - Dan King, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A lightly raced gelding, things are really starting to click with him now. He won back-to-back races at Wolverhampton and Newcastle, both over 7f. He went up a fair bit to 80 from an opening mark of 71 - the handicapper actually hiked him 8lb for his last win at Gosforth Park. He relished the stiff 7f there and although he won at Wolverhampton I was not sure the track suited him, and my fears were proved correct last week when he was never happy and although he ran on well at the end it is not his course. We will keep him to stiffer venues in the future and he can win again. 25-05-22

runners.name: Roman Harry
runners.comment: Sole win at this trip at Laytown; placed over 1m on AW since but tough ask at the weights
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over this trip on the beach at Laytown; placed over 1m in two starts at Newcastle this winter but well held at the Curragh 12 days ago back with his former yard and tough ask at the weights here.

runners.name: Skontonovski
runners.comment: 7-time course winner; creditable 2nd in C&D claimer when last seen; may need this
runners.spotlight: Seven-time course winner and dual C&D winner; won a 1m handicap here in November and bounced back from a lesser effort when beaten half a length in a C&D claimer in December; not seen since so may need this and he has the widest draw but capable of having a say if fully tuned up.

quotes.race: Bet On The Best Night Out At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Skontonovski is better suited by a mile. He travelled everywhere. This track suits him because they fan out and you can go wherever you want with him. I always felt I was going to get there - Ronan Whelan, rider

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Guaranteed Multiples All Shops Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Skontonovski grows a leg around here in that grade. It is a matter of not hitting the front too soon with him - Ronan Whelan, jockey.

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Skontonovski is a tricky ride and has to be played late but he is a solid horse in the grade. He has deserved a little break now before we freshen him up. We'll target something nice on the turf with him - Stephen Thorne, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Skontonovski didn't seem to get home at Roscommon. I told Ronnie to hold on to him for as long as he could, I put a visor on and it made a big difference and Ronnie was world class - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Solomon Coop
runners.comment: Off the mark in 1m maiden here but shaped like he may want further over C&D since
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when making his debut for this yard in a 1m maiden here last month; shaped like he may want a step back up in trip over this C&D subsequently though.

runners.name: Nika Pika
runners.comment: Losing run goes back to sole win in a turf maiden claimer in 2023; out of form here lately
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back to her sole success in a Navan maiden claimer in August 2023; out of form in three runs at this venue since finishing third in a 1m4f handicap at the start of the year; plenty to find on form.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Claiming Maiden
quotes.quote: Nika Pika had a good run at the Curragh but she just got stuck in holding ground at Galway. She got the mile well but there was no question about her stamina. We could look at a nursery now - Pat Magee, trainer.

runners.name: Signor Ferrari
runners.comment: Back-to-back winner over further here earlier in year; may need further than 7f these days
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back over the extended 1m2f here earlier in the year; beaten 8l when just 6-1 for a claimer here a fortnight ago and probably needs further than this trip now but has a chance at the weights.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Summer Season Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Signor Ferrari is a nice horse. He has a good turn of foot for a 1m2f horse and he stays well - Hugh Horgan, rider.

quotes.race: Blackwater Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I felt Signor Ferrari ran well last time at Killarney, finished fifth and was unlucky in running, didn't have a hard race and I thought he had a bit of a chance today.  He's pretty versatile ground-wise, he got there pretty easily and stuck his down when it mattered. Hopefully he'll gain confidence from that - Hugh Horgan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Super Over

prev_owners.owner: Ciaran J Mooney/Mark McCloskey/Adam Mooney/Colm Holmes

runners.comment: C&D winner; last win came over 1m a year ago; struggled in 4 runs for this yard
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; last win came over 1m here a year ago; has struggled in four runs for this yard and best watched for now.

quotes.race: Peter Fitzpatrick Leod Quarries Handicap
quotes.quote: Super Over is very consistent and he loves this place. He was good and gutsy. He's a jockey's dream ride. He wings the gates, he relaxes and he is very straightforward - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Story Of Dundalk Stadium Book Buy Online Apprentice Rated Race
quotes.quote: Maybe 7f was a little short for Super Over the last day but I thought he'd stay 1m well and I was happy to get a lead. I arrived there well and he stayed at it - Sam Ewing, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Notforalongtime
runners.comment: 3-time C&D winner inc' a h'cap last month but tough ask at these weights
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner including a handicap off a mark of 52 last month; didn't build on that when slowly away here three weeks ago and tough ask at these weights.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Notforalongtime had lost his way when I got him and he had a few problems so we were able to sweeten him up. The cheekpieces made a big difference. We'll come up for the winter with him - Laura Hourigan, trainer.

quotes.race: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I was chuffed with that, it was a nice enough race and Notforalongtime is a gutsy little horse - Adam Kirby, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We've gelded him and he's had a wind operation, which can hopefully help him take another step forward. I think he'll continue to progress over a mile and build on his head-bobbing win at Doncaster last summer. 22-04-21

runners.name: Little Keilee
runners.comment: C&D winner; latest win at 1m; below form on turf latest but not ruled out back on AW
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; latest win at 1m last month but not as good over C&D subsequently and well held on turf since; not ruled out back on AW at these weights and one to consider.

runners.name: Nezeeh
runners.comment: Step back in the right direction in recent claimer here; 6f probably too short since
runners.spotlight: Took a step back in the right direction when fourth in a 1m claimer here and 6f probably too short subsequently; respected back up in trip from the bottom of the weights.

runners.name: Superior Force
runners.comment: Both wins on soft but ran well over C&D 2 starts ago; didn't build on that latest
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come on soft on turf but was only beaten 1l in a C&D handicap two starts ago; didn't build on that over 1m since and has a bit to find at the weights with his stablemate.

6:00.race_name: Saturday 12th July Ladies Day At Dundalk Handicap

runners.name: Macadams Rock
runners.comment: All 3 wins over C&D and likely to have needed 6f return; back on last winning mark
runners.spotlight: All three wins over this C&D and likely to have needed his return over 6f three weeks ago; back on last winning mark and ought to go well.

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Macadam's Rock is a nice straightforward horse, we claimed him and he has won two, so we're delighted - Martin Ferris, owner

runners.name: Hemight
runners.comment: 0-10 and shown nothing for his last couple of starts; best watched from stall 16
runners.spotlight: 0-10 and shown nothing for his last couple of starts; best watched from stall 16.

runners.name: Harriet Eagle
runners.owner: Mrs Patrick J Flynn & Gavin Omahoney
runners.comment: Defied absence in 2024 to gain first win; disappointing fav since; return to 7f may help
runners.spotlight: Defied an absence when winning a 7f turf handicap at Gowran in July but was a disappointing favourite back there on only start since; return to 7f may help and not ruled out, despite 188-day absence.

runners.name: Camachero
runners.comment: 0-9; struggling prior to much improved run when 80-1 staying on 3rd; Keane takes over
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; had been struggling prior to a much improved effort when an 80-1 staying on third over 1m here in January; only up 1lb but should be a player with Keane taking over if he handles the drop in distance.

runners.name: Circles
runners.comment: All 3 wins over 7f on AW but hasn't been near her best this winter inc' 3 recent C&D runs
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come over 7f on AW (including two C&D) but hasn't been near her best this winter, including three recent C&D outings from similar marks.

quotes.race: Book Online @ DundalkStadium.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Circles had been running well without winning but she is probably a bit stronger now. We left it late but I didn't want to get there early and get caught - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Nikki Swango
runners.owner: Claire Wylie & Cathal Mcguckin & John C Mcconnell
runners.comment: Struggled for new yard and didn't beat a rival when eased down over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: Struggled for her new yard and eased out of things when last of 14 three weeks ago; well treated but hard to recommend in her current mood.

runners.name: Whatswrongnow
runners.comment: Promise without threatening here last winter but every chance he'll need this
runners.spotlight: Showed promise without threatening in a trio of runs here last winter; every chance he'll need this on debut for new trainer returning from 406 days off.

runners.name: Bucky Larson
runners.comment: 3-time course winner but those wins over further and shown nothing twice this winter
runners.spotlight: Rated 93 in his pomp and has three course wins to his name but they've come over 1m and he's shown nothing in two starts here this winter; looks reliant on first-time cheekpieces sparking a revival.

quotes.race: Dundalk Stadium Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has been coming down the handicap all year and I felt the last day that he was something like himself. He was entitled to do that - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson has a bit of class in races like that. He's a good lead horse at home and pulls one out of the bag every so often - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: "Paddy & Saoirse Casey" Handicap
quotes.quote: Bucky Larson is still a baby of a horse but we think he'll get ten furlongs in time. He's a lovely individual, he's growing up and I'd say there's another day or two in him - Ger Lyons, trainer

quotes.race: Leopardstown Summer Pass Maiden
quotes.quote: We rode him all wrong at Dundalk. We don't take back from the stalls and it was just the wrong way to ride him.His work at home had been good and he loves hunting one down. That's what we were expecting him to do at Dundalk and we were disappointed last time but I'd rather win here - Ger Lyons, trainer

runners.name: Manhattan Dandy
runners.comment: 3 wins with cut on turf; narrowly denied here latest but off 5 months and 7f may be sharp
runners.spotlight: His three wins have come with cut in the ground on turf but only beaten half a length here (1m) when last seen in November; likely to need this after five months off and 7f on AW might be sharp enough for him.

runners.name: Allo Arry

prev_owners.owner: Peter Cullen & J C McConnell Partnership

runners.comment: Sole win came in Laytown maiden; out of form when last seen and likely to need this
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in a 7f Laytorn maiden; out of form in three runs for his new connections when last seen and every chance he'll need this run after 350 days off.

runners.name: Havana Notion
runners.comment: 3-time winner inc' course winner; narrowly denied last week but questions at 7f
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner including a 6f course win and was only narrowly denied when run out of it late here last week; however, hasn't looked as effective at previous tries at 7f and could be vulnerable.

quotes.race: Botanica International Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Havana Notion has been a frustrating horse but he's never been beaten too far. He was a bit unlucky the last day at Down Royal - John Feane, trainer.

runners.name: Blue Wood
runners.comment: C&D winner but barely beaten a rival in three runs here this winter; risky
runners.spotlight: C&D winner but barely beaten a rival in three runs here this winter and looks a risky proposition.

runners.name: Hope And Innocence
runners.comment: 28-race maiden and her best recent form has come at 1m; best watched from wide draw
runners.spotlight: 28-race maiden and her best recent form has come at 1m; best watched from wide draw.

runners.name: Zero Fighter
runners.comment: Didn't beat a rival on return and best form has come over further
runners.spotlight: Struggled towards the back end of last term and failed to beat a rival on last month's return; best form has come over further.

runners.name: Latin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: 19-race maiden and probably needs further than this these days; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 19-race maiden and probably needs further than this these days.

runners.name: Feature This
runners.comment: 4-time course winner but wins over 1m and struggled twice here recently; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; four-time course winner but all her victories have come over 1m; struggled in last two runs at this venue.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This likes it up here. I was trying to get her to stay further but that's probably her trip. There was not much pace which probably suited her. She battled well and will probably keep going up here for the winter - Paul Flynn, trainer

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This got a grand ride from Robert, he did everything I asked. I thought she was a bit lairy so we stuck the cheekpieces on her but she did it well - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Harry The Rogue
runners.comment: 0-16; 2nd in 3 runs here before lesser run last week; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 16-race maiden but hit the crossbar in three starts here prior to a lesser effort last week.

6:30.race_name: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap

runners.name: Metamorpheus
runners.comment: 0-6 on the Flat; unsuited by drop in trip here latest; workable mark
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat but has shown ability and would have been unsuited by the drop in trip here two weeks ago; workable mark if he can build on that and probably has more to offer at this sort of distance.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to run Metamorpheus in the Boodles provided he sneaks in. 25-02-23

runners.name: Omakase
runners.comment: 1m4f winner here; interference when beaten 1l latest; stamina to prove at 2m
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner on penultimate start and suffered some interference when beaten roughly 1l here since; still feasibly treated but needs to prove she stays this new trip.

runners.name: Slowdownbarney
runners.comment: Placed in 3 1m4f h'caps here lately; 2m may suit but latest form knocked and he's 0-14
runners.spotlight: Hit the frame in last three runs, all over 1m4f here; shaped like he may appreciate this new trip when beaten half a length here three weeks ago; only up 1lb but form knocked since and his 0-14 record is off-putting.

runners.name: Tara Power
runners.comment: Gained first win since 2021 with 1m4f win here last month; stamina to prove at 2m
runners.spotlight: Gained first win since 2021 with a 1m4f success here last month; wasn't at that level last week though and not sure to stay this sort of trip.

runners.name: Billie Frechette
runners.comment: Shaped like 2m may suit when beaten a neck over 1m4f here; good run over timber latest
runners.spotlight: Shaped like further may suit when beaten a neck over 1m4f here in December; beaten favourite in her subsequent outing but ran with credit over timber last week and has untapped potential at this sort of trip in this sphere; respected with Keane on.

runners.name: Makaiah

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Lynne Lyons & Sean Jones & David Spratt

runners.comment: Some promise for Ger Lyons without winning; back from hurdle runs; interesting at new trip
runners.spotlight: Looked like she had a race in her for Ger Lyons last season; some minor promise over hurdles for new yard; interesting at this new trip in this sphere but others are more convincing.

runners.name: Pegasus Of Harry
runners.comment: 1m4f Wolverhampton winner; hasn't shown enough for new connections; tongue-tie; new trip
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner at Wolverhampton for Marco Botti a year ago; hasn't shown enough in her three runs for new connections; now tried with tongue-tie and new trip.

runners.name: Bright Start
runners.comment: Only win came on dirt in 2021; distant 3rd over C&D in Dec'; hasn't built on that since
runners.spotlight: Only win came on dirt at Meydan in 2021; managed to hit the frame when a distant third over C&D in December but hasn't built on that since.

runners.name: Is She Now
runners.comment: 0-12; below form fourth of seven over C&D last month in first-time cheekpieces (retained)
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; below form fourth of seven over C&D last month in first-time cheekpieces (retained); others more likely.

runners.name: Noble Expression
runners.comment: Highly encouraging narrow C&D defeat on yard debut; not near that level twice since
runners.spotlight: Highly encouraging yard debut after more than two years off in November but not near that level in two subsequent turf starts and brought down over timber since.

runners.name: Duke Otto
runners.comment: Gained 3rd win over timber last week; only beaten 2l over C&D previously
runners.spotlight: Gained a third win over timber at Wexford last week and was only beaten 2l over C&D on his penultimate start when outpaced at a crucial stage; not ruled out.

runners.name: Uberrima Fides
runners.comment: 0-13 on the level and this new trip needs to spark significant improvement
runners.spotlight: 0-13 on the level and this new trip needs to spark significant improvement after a low-key effort here a fortnight ago.

runners.name: Knock Flyer
runners.comment: Long-standing maiden and hasn't beaten a rival in last three Flat runs; off 135 days
runners.spotlight: Long-standing maiden and hasn't beaten a rival in last three Flat runs; off 135 days.

7:00.race_name: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)

runners.name: Stop The Nation
runners.comment: 80,000Euros yearling; yard able to produce an early juvenile so any market strength noted
runners.spotlight: Sioux Nation colt cost 80,000Euros as a yearling; second foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 92), half-sister to winners Mbappe (7f/7.6f) and Arion Fox (6f 2yo); yard able to produce an early juvenile so any market strength should be noted.

runners.name: Nuevo Slovo
runners.comment: Cheaply bought yearling but worth a market watch
runners.spotlight: James Garfield gelding cost just 3,000Euros as a yearling; fifth foal; half-brother to winners Commander Straker (5f 2yo; RPR 88) and Dayem (Bahrain 6f); dam 7f/1m AW winner (81), half-sister to 6f Listed winner Katia, out of half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 1 winner Wootton Bassett; another for whom market best guide.

runners.name: A Daughters Love
runners.comment: Yard without a 2yo winner in last five years, albeit from small numbers
runners.spotlight: Mohaather filly cost 10,000gns as a foal and 4,000Euros as a yearling; fourth foal; half-sister to winners Vondelpark (1m inc 2yo; RPR 73) and Lethal Touch (9.4f AW/1m2f turf; 71); dam unraced half-sister to useful 7f/1m2f 2yo winner Al Ghazal; yard without a 2yo winner in last five years, albeit from small numbers.

runners.name: Lady Iman
runners.comment: Fetched 185,000GBP as a yearling; major respect from top yard
runners.spotlight: Starman filly went through the ring for 185,000GBP as a yearling; third foal; half-sister to winners West Acre (5f including 2yo/AW/UAE Group 2; RPR 112) and Succession (5f 2yo; 87); dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (101), half-sister to useful/prolific 5f-5.7f winner (inc 2yo) Union Rose; major respect from top yard which has made a bright start to the season.

runners.name: Luna Beaux
runners.comment: Bred to be an early type so don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior filly is second foal; half-sister to 6f AW 2yo winner Good Banter (RPR 93); dam 6f-1m winner (including 2yo; 80), half-sister to useful winners Ghost Serge (6f-1m4f Flat including 2yo; 2m hurdle) and Barley (1m); bred to be an early type so don't rule out.

runners.name: Leblon Beach
runners.comment: Mild debut promise recently on turf; improvement expected
runners.spotlight: Early speed on recent debut in a Curragh maiden won by better-fancied stablemate Power Blue; all the better for that experience and no surprise if she played a role here; yard has been enjoying a fine time of it here of late.

runners.name: Parallax
runners.comment: Cotai Glory filly cost 10,000Euros as a yearling; yard not renowned for juvenile winners
runners.spotlight: Cotai Glory filly cost 10,000Euros as a yearling; fourth foal; dam placed 7f/1m (RPR 72), half-sister to 7.5f 2yo winner Don Julio, out of 7f 2yo Group 3 winning half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Memory; yard not renowned for juvenile winners.

runners.name: Army Leave
runners.comment: Curragh debut third augurs well; should play a role
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought filly but quite strong in the market and showed definite ability on recent Curragh debut, keen enough but speed for much of way in finishing third (Leblon Beach fifth); that experience should stand to her here and should play a role.

runners.name: Innumerable
runners.owner: International Equine Llc, Shamrock Tbreds, A F Ocallaghan
runners.comment: Bred to need further but respected from in-form yard and from a good draw
runners.spotlight: Inns Of Court filly cost 38,000Euros as a yearling; half-sister to five winners inc Blakeney Point (1m4f-2m including AW/Listed; RPR 109), Lady Tiana (1m-1m4f including AW/Listed; 108), Percy's Pride (1m2f AW/1m4f; 91) and Angel From Above (6f; 79); dam 1m winner (79); quite stoutly-bred on the dam side and may need further in time but yard has a fine recent record here and debutante has to be respected from a good draw.

runners.name: Carthaginian
runners.comment: Dropped away quickly on recent Curragh debut to finish last of 18; may need more time
runners.spotlight: Dropped away quickly on recent Curragh debut to finish last of 18; may need more time.

runners.name: Paint The Moon
runners.comment: Unlikely one to make an immediate impact on belated debut
runners.spotlight: Iffraaj gelding a 6,000gns foal and 10,000Euros yearling; half-brother to 6f-7.5f 2yo AW winner Najm (including France; RPR 81); dam 6f winner (including AW; 82) half-sister to 1m-1m2f winner Aurelia Cotter; unlikely one to make an immediate impact on belated debut.

runners.name: Arcoiris
runners.comment: Blew the start on last month's so did okay in the circumstances; improvement likely
runners.spotlight: Blew the start on last month's debut here so did okay in the circumstances when staying on in midfield; improvement likely.

runners.name: Colugo
runners.comment: Recent comeback second augurs well but more likely needed to go one better
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut over almost 1m2f at Gowran last summer but was well below that level twice after; back to similar level of form on last month's return here, forcing much of pace when beaten 0.5l in an admittedly weak maiden over 7f (Winsome third); step up in trip could suit here but this looks a stronger maiden.

runners.name: Elana Osario
runners.comment: Last year's mid-distance form makes her the one to beat if coping with drop in trip
runners.spotlight: A 375,000gns yearling; Lope De Vega filly holds the best form credentials on last season's turf form over middle-distances on various types of ground, best effort on final start when positively ridden second at the Curragh (1m4f); similar tactics likely here now dropped in trip.

runners.name: Mallavelly
runners.comment: Solid enough maiden handicapper in Britain last year; new headgear combination tried
runners.spotlight: Generally consistent last term for Jane Chapple-Hyam, making frame in handicaps at Goodwood and Epsom at around this trip; ran badly in first-time cheekpieces final start at Newmarket; bought for 68,000gns at Newmarket December Sales and new headgear combination tried on yard/AW debut.

runners.name: Pare Of Brown Eyes
runners.comment: Towards the rear in both turf maidens last summer; can only be watched here on return
runners.spotlight: Towards the rear in both turf maidens last summer; can only be watched here on return.

runners.name: Shaool
runners.comment: Okay form in 3 end of season maidens last term for previous yard; drops in trip
runners.spotlight: Okay form in three end of season maidens last term for previous yard, latter occasion here over 1m4f; drops in trip on yard debut.

runners.name: Winsome
runners.comment: Return to 1m to suit but likely place claims at best
runners.spotlight: An expensive yearling who took time to get to the track, best of four runs at this track when second over this trip last month; drop in trip didn't seem to suit nine days later when only third in a weak maiden (Colugo second); place claims at best here.

8:00.race_name: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Maiden

runners.name: Dabashan
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Aga Khan
runners.comment: Teofilo colt; market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Teofilo colt is closely related to 1m AW winner Daboya (RPR 80), half-brother to winners Dabana (1m AW; 84) and Dabirann (1m AW 2yo; 75); dam 9.4f/1m2f winner (97), half-sister to winners Dabiyr (Australian 12.5f Listed) and Dabadiyan (useful 1m4f-1m6f); market best guide on debut.

runners.name: No Mo Cash
runners.comment: Uncle Mo colt; interesting debutant, market worth a look
runners.spotlight: Uncle Mo colt cost USD30,000 as a yearling; third foal; dam twice-raced 1m2f/Listed 1m4f winner (RPR 103), half-sister to winners Echo Of Light (multiple 1m-1m2f Group 2/3) and Akarem (smart 1m1f-1m4f), family of 1,000 Guineas/Oaks winner Salsabil; interesting debutant, market worth a look.

runners.name: Propose
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Showed enough on sole 2yo start to suggest he'll play a major role here
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt never landed a blow on debut in end of season Curragh maiden (1m) but showed enough to suggest he has a future; no surprise if he played a major role here.

runners.name: Quickshot
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Looks a more likely type for handicaps on recent evidence
runners.spotlight: Was beaten 6l in a C&D maiden on debut last month and worse run at the Curragh since; handicaps more likely his route to success.

runners.name: Rubadub Dubh
runners.comment: Debutant seemingly the lesser likely of the Lyons' pair on jockey bookings
runners.spotlight: Dark Angel gelding cost 11,000Euros as a yearling; brother to 5f winner Motashaweq (RPR 70), half-brother to winners Jadeerah (1m AW; 95) and Nawassi (7f 2yo; 82); dam 5f 2yo winner (including Group 2)/1,000 Guineas third (111); seemingly the lesser likely of the Lyons' pair on jockey bookings.

runners.name: Truth Be Told
runners.comment: Solid juvenile form; cheekpieces now tried and step up in trip could bring improvement
runners.spotlight: Decent level of form in four juvenile runs, final occasion here over 1m when tongue-tied; cheekpieces now tried and step up in trip could bring improvement.

runners.name: Whats Your Game
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: C&D second last month; probably has more on his plate here so needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in 1m maiden here in November, and again over C&D last month when chasing home a decisive winner; probably has more on his plate here so needs to improve.

runners.name: Woodshaw Whisper
runners.comment: Plenty of debut promise last autumn for previous yard; big player if handling surface
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt ran second in a barrier trial here last year and outran big odds for M Halford/T Collins team in late-season Leopardstown maiden, staying on from well back to get up for third over 1m; likely big player if handling the surface.

runners.name: Can I Kiss You
runners.comment: Some debut promise here last month (1m); lot more likely required to feature here though
runners.spotlight: Big odds but shaped with some debut promise here last month (1m); lot more likely required to feature here though.

runners.name: Mischievous Millie
runners.comment: Never recovered from a slow start on recent debut here (1m); probably best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Never recovered from a slow start on recent debut here (1m); probably best watched for now.

runners.name: Wrecking Ball Paul
runners.comment: C&D winner; really struggled this winter inc' when tailed off over 2m 3 weeks ago
runners.spotlight: C&D winner but really struggling this winter, including over 2m three weeks ago when tailed off and failing to beat a rival; now tried with first-time blinkers and hard to recommend.

quotes.race: Peter K. Hits The Big 50 (Q.R.) Handicap
quotes.quote: Wrecking Ball Paul went very well and I didn't actually realise how much of a gap there was until I came round the home bend. I knew then I had lots of horse left under me and I wasn't too worried. Paul (Mulligan, trainer) said to get a breather into him and I gave him one down the back, but I didn't realise how far ahead I was - Kevin Healy, jockey.

quotes.race: Axa Farm Insurance Midlands National Day Friday 14th July Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wrecking Ball Paul has been knocking on the door,. He is a bit of a headcase and needs settling down but Ben Harvey is a seriously good jockey, he did exactly what he was told. He ran at Listowel yesterday and it just took the edge off him - Paul Mulligan, trainer

runners.name: Dynamite Defense
runners.comment: Beat subsequent winner on sole AW outing and shaped like new trip may suit when 4th since
runners.spotlight: Got the better of Comfort Line (won twice since) on sole AW outing in September; shaped like he may appreciate this trip when fourth since and one to consider, despite 169-day absence and wide draw.

runners.name: Chopsticks
runners.comment: 0-14 but consistent and ran another creditable race over C&D in January
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden but more consistent than that record suggests and ran another creditable race over C&D in January; one of these should fall his way and looks a big player from the same mark.

runners.name: Flier
runners.owner: Richard Wilmot-Smith & Exors Of The Late Paul Darling
runners.comment: 0-17 on Flat; career best came over C&D last winter; may appreciate a drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-17 on the Flat; career best came over this C&D last winter; possible she will appreciate a return to this trip and has an each-way squeak.

runners.name: Gatsby Cap
runners.comment: 4-time course winner but all wins over shorter trips and best watched after 349 days off
runners.spotlight: Four-time course winner but all of his wins have come over shorter; hasn't looked as effective at 1m2f+; best watched on back of 349-day absence.

quotes.race: GAIN Equine Nutrition Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap is tough in fairness to him, he hasn't been spared. We'll just keep pooching away with him - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

quotes.race: LMFM Dual Race Night Friday 3rd May Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap travelled well through the race and did it easily. He did it very easy off that rating and I can see him going well in better company - Andy Slattery, rider

runners.name: Our Lucky Lady
runners.comment: Modest form in trio of course maidens, including over C&D latest; improvement required
runners.spotlight: Modest form in trio of course maidens, including over C&D latest and needs marked improvement to defy this mark on handicap debut.

runners.name: Randall Poets Lass
runners.comment: 0-15 but promising course debut latest and may come on for that; drops in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-15 but her course debut here three weeks ago wasn't devoid of promise; may come on for that and return to shorter should be okay too.

runners.name: Tyder
runners.comment: 2nd in Leopardstown h'cap last term; disappointing since; no signs of revival latest
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Leopardstown handicap last season but disappointing since and no signs of a revival over C&D last month.

runners.name: Villemacho
runners.comment: 1-40 but shown ability for new connections; may appreciate further here
runners.spotlight: Just 1-40 but has shown ability for his new connections this winter and latest effort over 7f worth forgiving; workable mark.

runners.name: Accompanist
runners.comment: Shown little in 3 maidens so far; return to further may help on hcap debut; plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Shown very little in a trio of maidens so far; step back up in trip may help on handicap debut but plenty to find.

runners.name: Harbanaker
runners.comment: 3 wins at 1m inc' 2 here; only seen once since 2023; changed yards after low-key return
runners.spotlight: Three wins at 1m including two course wins but only seen once since 2023; changed yards again after low-key return last month; widest draw.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Harbanaker was a bit far back and hit a small bit of a flat spot but when I got a few back-handers into him he ran all the way to the line - Robert Whearty rider.

runners.name: Together Aclaim
runners.comment: 1-33; sole win over C&D; encouraging return but not as good since over C&D
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 33 starts came over C&D; encouraging return to action despite racing keenly in January but subsequent C&D effort was modest.

runners.name: Sea Of Beauty
runners.comment: Shown very little in 7 maidens so far; looks vulnerable back up in trip on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: Shown very little in seven maiden starts so far; looks vulnerable back up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Wonder Spirit
runners.comment: Has really lost his way this winter; needs return to further to spark a revival
runners.spotlight: Sole win came here two years ago but has really lost his way this winter; needs return to further to spark a revival.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter @DundalkStadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Wonder Spirit was placed off higher marks for Noel Meade and I think freshness is the key to him. He was bouncing today and got a very canny ride from James - George Kingston, trainer.

runners.name: Higher Kingdom
runners.comment: C&D winner; only beat one home on yard debut last week but was well backed; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; four-time course winner (including C&D); only beat one home on yard debut last week but was well backed.

quotes.race: Floodlit Friday Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Higher Kingdom is a talented horse. He travelled like a dream and he just did enough - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has really progressed this winter as having won off 62 in December at Dundalk, he has since added two more wins at the track and is up to a rating of 86 now. The plan is to send him over to Lingfield on Good Friday for either the 1m or 1m2f race. Even though he's now at a career-high mark, I think there could be a little more to come. He's a very talented horse who was highly thought of as a juvenile, but like so many Kingmans he has a mind of his own and has taken a while to get back on track. He was disappointing last time out, but he seems grand at the moment and we'll almost certainly be claiming off him at Lingfield. I'm not entirely sure who'll get the ride but Siobhan Rutledge has won twice on him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Lord Talbot
runners.owner: Elaine Shevlin & David Boylan & Ms Denise Mccourt
runners.comment: C&D winner; lightly raced and may have needed last week's 1m4f run; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; C&D winner; lightly raced and may have needed last week's 1m4f run.

3:45.race_name: Smith And Western Chase Series Final (A Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
3:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +12yds)

runners.name: Good Friday Fairy
runners.comment: Bidding for 3-3 in cheekpieces; the move away from soft/heavy may be the chief question
runners.spotlight: The cheekpieces went on for his last two starts and he's raised his game, winning in small fields at Wincanton (2m4f, soft; by 16l) and Taunton (extended 2m5f, soft; comfortably) 12 days later; won a maiden hurdle on good to soft in April 2023 but has raced on only soft or heavy since; that seems to ask as much of a question as latest 6lb rise, but he's shortlisted.

quotes.race: Richard Williams Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Good Friday Fairy a real puzzle as he can be nervous at the races, so we don't run him too far away from home, but he's a real warrior too. When things go right he's very decent. The cheekpieces have definitely helped and Sam's gelled with him immediately. He's a very hardy horse and I wouldn't be surprised if you see him out in the next ten days or so - Ben Clarke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I ride him myself every day and he's a proper puzzle. He's a little bit quirky and very soft. We've just worked out that he doesn't want to be going too far away from home - two and a half hours is probably tops because as soon as he knows he's going racing he gets very worked up. We've also changed his diet and it's certainly done no harm. He's a good jumper and Sam Twiston-Davies has gelled with him very well. He loves a small field that he can dominate but he doesn't have to lead. He might run in a couple of weeks at Newbury or he might go to Fontwell right at the end of the month for a Â£40,000 race he's qualified for. He's a decent horse and there's still room in his mark. 12-03-25

runners.name: Next Left
runners.comment: Did well last spring/autumn; beaten 20l on his last two starts; wears headgear first time
runners.spotlight: Beaten 20l on his last two starts, after four months off; however, he did well over fences last spring/autumn and the best of those efforts give him a big shout; wears headgear first time.

runners.name: Royal Mer
runners.comment: 2nd last two runs, latest to Diplomatic Ash here; plenty to prove away from soft or heavy
runners.spotlight: Won five soft-ground chases last season (the first two over about 2m4f, the rest about 2m); working his way back to form with second on his last two starts, the latest over C&D when close behind Diplomatic Ash, but both those were also in the mud and he has plenty to prove away from soft or heavy.

runners.name: Diplomatic Ash
runners.comment: His career seems to be taking off again (two wins here this month) and he's respected
runners.spotlight: Won this month over C&D (soft; from Royal Mer) and back here (2m2f, good) 11 days later; wore first-time cheekpieces last time; both wins were in small fields but his career seems to be taking off again and he's respected despite the clear need for better still under 7lb penalty.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Handicap Chase (Fontwell Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Diplomatic Ash did that well considering we didn't think he'd like the ground - Gary Moore, joint-trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Zestful Hope
runners.comment: No win away from Hereford but the 5lb rise since winning last time does not rule him out
runners.spotlight: 4-6 at Hereford and has never scored anywhere else but he was short-headed at Uttoxeter in November; last month's win (2m3f, good to soft) was his first for over two years and his best form for almost as long, also his first chase win at 12th attempt, but the runner-up scored next time and they were miles clear of the third, so going back up 5lb does not rule him out.

runners.name: Koenigsstern
runners.comment: 2m2f win here in December; not so good next time and tailed off in cheekpieces latest
runners.spotlight: Two seconds (one here) before winning over 2m2f at this track on soft ground in December; not so good at Huntingdon next time and tailed off when tried in cheekpieces here three weeks ago; they are now set aside but the return to this longer trip may not be ideal.

quotes.race: Daily Offers With BetMGM Handicap Chase (Fontwell Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Koenigsstern had been running really well without winning, but here I thought he jumped incredibly well. He'd already qualified for the final before this, but we want to keep them running and this looked like the right race, but the final will be the target now. All of my horses are running really well, so long may it continue - Nick Gifford, trainer.

runners.name: Fame And Fun
runners.comment: Won easily here (2m6f, heavy) in January and he did win on good ground one year ago
runners.spotlight: Won easily here (2m6f, heavy) in January when back over fences for his second start for this stable; didn't jump well over hurdles next time but third in a chase at Ffos Las (2m4f) was much more like it again and he did win on good ground one year ago; considered each-way.

stable_tour.quote: He wants summer ground. He won a chase in January at Fontwell despite the going, but he didn't go so well on the heavy at Ffos Las last time out. We'll see the best of him this summer. 26-03-25

runners.name: Call Off The Dogs

prev_owners.owner: Galloping On The South Downs Partnership

runners.comment: Good record here; off since November but he's still one to note with ground to suit
runners.spotlight: Four wins and two seconds from ten races at Fontwell, including two wins last May and one last September; off since November and now a 10yo but he's still one to note with ground to suit.

runners.name: Joe Cotton

prev_owners.owner: The Boundary Stables Partnership ( C R Barber)

runners.comment: It's easy to see him on the premises if first-time blinkers don't have an adverse effect
runners.spotlight: Sole win under rules was chase debut one year ago; cheekpieces all seven starts since, including when runner-up four times (once here) in a row October-January; respectable third at Exeter latest outing and it's easy to see him on the premises if first-time blinkers don't have an adverse effect.

runners.name: Doc Mccoy

prev_owners.owner: Ian Chanin, Tom Hooper, Peter Kingwell & Mark Booth

runners.comment: This season's four runs over fences were not inspiring; cheekpieces latest, now blinkers
runners.spotlight: Has won a point (2022) and maiden hurdle (2023) but this season's four runs over fences have not been inspiring; tried cheekpieces here last time and now it's blinkers.

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame Doc McCoy didn't win his bumper, but he has always been a proper jumper. He is an embryonic chaser as he won a point-to-point at Great Trethew. He bowled along in front when he won his point-to-point so we thought we would let him bowl along and make it a test. We could aim him at the EBF Final at Sandown in March. That  is probably his kind of race as it suits proper staying chasers. That will probably be his target - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his hurdling debut before finishing fourth under a penalty, but he picked up an injury soon afterwards. He's back from a break and will go novice chasing. 06-11-24

Novice hurdling is the plan for him and he jumps well, while he performed to a good level in his bumpers, finishing in the places on all three starts. It was a shame he didn't win one, but Datsalrightgino didn't either. 28-09-23

runners.name: Hatos
runners.comment: Made the frame on all five starts this season but soundly beaten last two; tongue-tie off
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on all five appearances this season but he was soundly beaten on last two occasions; continues to slip down the weights; usually tongue tied but not today.

quotes.race: Play Coral Racing Super Series For Free Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: I think having a hurdle in front of him was beneficial to Hatos and what pleased me was he ran right to the line, whereas in his bumper he was maybe a bit one-paced and weakened. He ground it out today when it got tough. He loves that ground, the heavier the better. I think it's important to him because he travels so easily on it. He could be a really nice two-mile heavy-ground chaser in the future. He's a lovely straightforward horse and we might go for a similar race with a penalty. We'll see where his hurdling takes us, but I love that two-mile heavy-ground chase division - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely young horse who made an encouraging start to his hurdling career when winning at Chepstow in January. Unfortunately he sustained a small puncture wound on that occasion which kept him off for the rest of the season. I sent him up to Hexham in April but he simply could not handle the unique undulations of the course. Hopefully he can build on his chasing debut at Chepstown last week when he finished well beaten. I always had it in my mind that soft/heavy is what he needs to be at his best as he has a good cruising speed on those conditions. 30-11-22

runners.name: Valirann Gold
runners.owner: Mrs Andrew May And Mrs Mark Bentley
runners.comment: Form is up and down; one win (here last February) in last 20 starts; 4lb out of handicap
runners.spotlight: His form is up and down and he's posted just one win (here last February) from his last 20 starts; 4lb out of the handicap.

4:20.race_name: Millstone Landscapes Stuart Wilkins Memorial Race Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
4:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +12yds)

runners.name: Elysian Knight
runners.comment: Pulled up when 14-1 in the EBF Final at Sandown three weeks ago but could bounce back
runners.spotlight: 40-1 win at Ffos Las (soft) and creditable third at Fakenham (good) next time, both at 2m4f; pulled up when 14-1 in the EBF Final at Sandown (good to soft) three weeks ago but this is a vastly less competitive affair and he could bounce back; in the shake-up if he does.

quotes.race: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Elysian Knight ran well at Plumpton, his first time over hurdles, I don't think there is massive improvement really. He ran well in his bumpers. We always thought he was a nice horse - Neil Mulholland, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Tommy The Tank
runners.comment: Easy odds-on winner last time (3m2f); perhaps more a staying prospect but he's promising
runners.spotlight: Won British maiden point by 7l on debut in April 2023; absent until second this season in maiden hurdles here (near 2m4f) and at Ascot (extended 2m5f) before easily going one better when 8-13 at Hereford (3m2f); last two of those (his best form) were on good to soft, unraced on good; perhaps more of a staying prospect but he's promising.

runners.name: Authentic Legacy
runners.comment: Off the mark in 2m handicap at Newbury latest; penultimate start makes this trip a worry
runners.spotlight: Failed to get home over 2m4f at Sandown on penultimate start, having raced freely on his only go in cheekpieces; progressive over shorter than that and got off the mark in 2m handicap at Newbury (soft) on latest outing but, despite his pedigree, this trip is a worry.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It all went wrong at Sandown the other day when we tried Authentic Legacy over two and a half miles. I put cheekpieces on him, but he was far too keen and the headgear overdid it. He always looks like he needs to go further, so you start to wonder if he's tripless. He's a chaser in the making and I do hold him in reasonable regard. He's got the size and scope, and he's very athletic, and he should take to a fence - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was very green last season and has taken time to mature but seems to have done well through the summer. We'll see how he runs on his comeback at Fakenham on Wednesday but he might need a bit of racing to help him grow up this season. He should stay two and a half miles and is a nice type. 29-10-24

runners.name: Doctor Midas
runners.breeder: S C E A De La Fontaine
runners.comment: Three starts for Nicky Henderson, second to an impressive winner in a 3m maiden at Ludlow
runners.spotlight: Had three starts for Nicky Henderson, ending last month with second to an impressive winner in maiden hurdle at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) where he was hampered at the third last but that did not cost him the win; has changed hands and should still have some potential but the penalised winners in this have shown a fair bit more.

stable_tour.quote: For one reason or another he saw the racecourse only once at the backend of last season at Haydock. He never really travelled and was incredibly green, but he's had a good summer and will be a much stronger individual this time round. He'll start straight over hurdles. 22-10-24

runners.name: Fox Cottage
runners.comment: Beaten about 40l on soft in a bumper here (8-1) and 2m maiden hurdle at Plumpton (150-1)
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 40l on soft ground in a bumper here (8-1) and 2m maiden hurdle at Plumpton (150-1); upped markedly in trip but best watched.

3:10.race_name: Millstone Landscapes Charity Race Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)
3:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +12yds)

runners.name: Blue Bellamy
runners.comment: Hurdle debut was satisfactory; disappointed next time; none of his form looks good enough
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his Irish points and minor honours in all three bumpers; while hurdling debut at Lingfield (2m, heavy) in January was satisfactory, he disappointed there (2m3f, soft) next time and none of his form makes him a leading contender today.

runners.name: Boston Boy
runners.comment: Ran out twice; confirmed plenty of ability next time; 2m7f didn't work out on latest start
runners.spotlight: Ran out two from home in consecutive races late last year; confirmed he has plenty of ability when third at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) in January, covered up as he made his way from rear, and raced too freely when upped to 2m7f for handicap debut at Ascot (good) six weeks ago; there's a big rethink on trip today and he is one of the top three on ratings.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he'd run a little better than he did in his bumpers, but we've switched a few things up and I expect to see a lot more from him this season over hurdles. He took a good blow at the second-last at Uttoxeter on Friday but travelled with a lot of zest and jumped well to that point. Ultimately he's going to be a staying chaser, but I'd like to think he'll be able to pick up a maiden hurdle off the back of that run. 06-11-24

runners.name: French Symphony
runners.comment: Below best last three starts and latest (visored) was a shocker; now has his tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Favourite three times but he's 0-3 in bumpers and 0-5 over hurdles; had wind surgery in November but below best in his three starts since, particularly latest (2m4f) which was a shocker when a visor was tried and he made the running; now has his tongue tied.

runners.name: Kalif Dairy
runners.breeder: S C E A De La Vallee De L'Orne
runners.owner: S Packham, A Austin And B Austin
runners.comment: 0-9 overall but second in three consecutive starts this winter; flop in cheekpieces latest
runners.spotlight: 0-9 overall but second on a variety of ground at Fontwell (2m3f), Fakenham (2m) and Sandown (2m4f) in three consecutive starts this winter; flop in first-time cheekpieces here (extended 2m5f) last time is the big worry but he has a huge shout on those earlier performances.

runners.name: Sgian Dubh
runners.comment: Better on latest start but subsequent wind surgery still needs to make a big difference
runners.spotlight: Although first-time headgear seemed to get a response when fifth of 14 to a runaway winner at Kempton (2m) on latest outing, he still has major work to do; the subsequent wind surgery needs to make a big difference.

runners.name: Spectre One
runners.comment: 25-1 fourth on hurdle debut at Southwell (2m) was miles better than starts either side
runners.spotlight: 25-1 fourth on hurdle debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) in February was miles better than his starts either side, the latest in a Ludlow novice (2m, soft); needs marked overall improvement.

runners.name: Surrey Lord
runners.comment: Significant ability in bumpers but a mile behind first two on hurdle debut at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Showed significant ability in three bumpers, particularly at Kempton (soft) latest; however, although third of nine on hurdle debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) early this month, he finished an awfully long way behind the first two; needs to step up dramatically from that performance.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really nice horse who has plenty of talent. He's big and strong and seems to have some gears about him. He'll have one more bumper, having been fourth in one at Kempton last week, and I think the experience will do him no harm. We'll try to find a race where he can get his head in front. We won't go over hurdles before March as I wouldn't want to cut short a novice campaign. He takes his racing very well and I think we'll have a lot of fun with him in time. 12-02-25

runners.name: Whatsyourproblem
runners.comment: British form is moving back in right direction; 2nd at Southwell (2m; evens) latest outing
runners.spotlight: Second on Irish debut last February makes it pretty surprising that he's now 0-8; however, his British form has been moving back in that direction and he was second at Southwell (2m, good to soft; evens) on latest outing; serious contender.

runners.name: Precious Jean
runners.comment: Minor form in three bumpers suggests she is best watched on this hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Minor form in three bumpers (made a respiratory noise on second start) suggests she is best watched on this hurdle debut, despite pedigree.

runners.name: Surrey Nemesis
runners.comment: Low-level form after three bumpers and three hurdle races
runners.spotlight: Low-level form after three bumpers and three hurdle races; tried a tongue-tie twice last season and cheekpieces on latest outing.

2:40.race_name: Millstone Landscapes Sponsored Raceday Inaugural Race Handicap Chase
2:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +12yds)

runners.name: Calvic
runners.comment: Absent 176 days and needs respect judged on his two wins in 2024
runners.spotlight: His two wins (from 11 chases) were over an extended 2m4f on good ground at Huntingdon last March and Worcester last June, the latter in first-time cheekpieces which he's worn almost every time since; out of form on last two starts but absent 176 days since and needs respect.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The drying ground is the important thing. We may step Calvic up in trip on the back at that, especially on that ground - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

runners.name: Sangiovese
runners.comment: Only fifth of six on chase debut latest but this step back up in trip will presumably help
runners.spotlight: Tends to need plenty of riding and sole win (2m4f) was in January 2024 on handicap debut; pretty reliable since and although chase debut last time saw him finish only fifth of six, this step back up in trip will presumably help him and he's one of the youngsters in this field; needs a second look.

runners.name: Sir Rock
runners.comment: C&D winner; surged back to form with second at Huntingdon (3m) last time
runners.spotlight: Completed a double last winter, the second leg over C&D; struggled badly this season, tried in different types of headgear and given wind surgery before penultimate start, before he surged back to form with second at Huntingdon (3m) last time; that form puts him back into serious calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a little disappointing and frustrating this season. He's never actually made a noise but we didn't know whether there was something going on in there, so I did a little wind op with him before his last run at Fontwell and he took a step forward by at least finishing his race. I'd expect another good step forward and hopefully he'll get back to what he was doing last season and just being solid and consistent. I feel we've found what was possibly troubling him and we're heading back in the right direction. 12-02-25

runners.name: Fine Investment
runners.comment: 1-7 in points and 0-10 under rules; does not look the percentage call
runners.spotlight: 1-7 in points and 0-10 under rules; took a minor honour over 2m4f on heavy at Leicester in late February for the second year running, this time after 286 days off, but he does not look the percentage call.

runners.name: The Cox Express
runners.comment: Chasing last three starts, easily best effort on first; cheekpieces give way to blinkers
runners.spotlight: Second of 15 on chase debut at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft) in December but ran way below market expectations over about 2m7f on both starts since, never going well last time; wore cheekpieces on seven of his last eight starts and now tries blinkers; big player if judged on the Exeter run.

quotes.race: Wigley Community Fund "Newcomers" National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Cox Express was a homebred and the owners thought he was more a bumper type than a Flat type. He's always gone well at home and is for sale - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.name: Wellwillya
runners.comment: Won first and latest of five chases; considered despite poor earlier record on good ground
runners.spotlight: Has an in-and-out record in his five chases but that includes wins on the first and latest attempts, latterly over C&D, and he was miles out of the handicap when pulled up on penultimate start; considered despite a poor record on good ground in bumpers and over hurdles.

runners.name: King Of The Story
runners.comment: Best 2023 efforts (including C&D win on good) give him a shot but he's been off 493 days
runners.spotlight: Mixed record for this stable in 2023 but won in good style off this mark over C&D (good) that August and ended with a creditable run in November; the absence since is a concern given his poor first-time-out record.

runners.name: Tommy Dillion
runners.comment: Switched to chasing for last four starts and they don't offer encouragement
runners.spotlight: Sole win in late 2022; switched to chasing for last four starts (absent 417 days after first of those) and they don't offer encouragement.

runners.name: No Drama
runners.comment: His four runs since huge absence don't suggest he's come far enough down the weights
runners.spotlight: Although some ability remains, his four runs since a huge absence don't suggest he's come far enough down the weights.

runners.name: Design Flaw
runners.comment: Modest at best in Ireland; no worthwhile form in four races in Britain since; blinkers now
runners.spotlight: Modest at best in Ireland; no worthwhile form in four British races since and well out of the handicap again; blinkers replace recent cheekpieces.

2:10.race_name: James Place "Hands And Heels" Handicap Hurdle (Conditional & Amateur Jockeys') (RE Initiative)
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +12yds)

runners.name: Bank On Frank
runners.comment: Major improvement is needed on this handicap debut; marked step up in trip in weak race
runners.spotlight: Second in 2m4f maiden point in February 2023; four hurdle races (all on softer than good) this season, catching the eye of the stewards on penultimate start and finishing closer here latest; major improvement is still needed on this handicap debut but this is a marked step up in trip in weak race.

runners.name: Ghasham
runners.breeder: A O'Brien,M Al Monsour& K Al' Attiyah
runners.comment: Placed last three; bit further to go (unsure to stay) and best efforts on softer than good
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with two poor AW runs in the autumn but has worked his way back into form over hurdles since, with places at Huntingdon, Uttoxeter and Warwick on last three outings; has a little further to go here (not sure to stay) and best efforts on softer than good.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Social Media Maiden
quotes.quote: Ghasham is a massive big horse and looks progressive. It was a nice performance and there is a lot of improvement to come from him. He loved that ground and was very tough - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Shuil Ceoil
runners.comment: Reverted to hurdles from fences with a C&D win (soft) in January; also effective on good
runners.spotlight: Reverted to hurdles from fences with a C&D win (soft) in January; also effective on good/good to soft; came clear with the runner-up last time (raised 6lb since) and looks a leading player in this weak race.

runners.name: Bobalot
runners.comment: Placed at Chepstow (extended 2m3f) and Hereford (3m2f, good) either side of an unseat here
runners.spotlight: Latest of two wins was C&D in January 2024; new trainer last three outings, when unseating mid-race here on second occasion but placed at Chepstow (extended 2m3f) and Hereford (3m2f, good) either side; thereabouts again.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed Daily At Vickers.Bet Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Bobalot reverted back to hurdles after not enjoying jumping fences. He's got a Flat pedigree, so he appreciated that drop to them and he's well handicapped over hurdles. We knew if he was happy over them then he should run well and Tom [Bellamy] gave him a great ride - Ben Clarke, trainer.

runners.name: Summer In Milan
runners.owner: The Les & Jan Gilbert Racing Legacy

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late L Gilbert

runners.comment: Respectable chase debut; back hurdling with overall improvement needed in first headgear
runners.spotlight: About 10l third of ten to Shuil Ceoil over C&D in the second of his three handicaps; ran respectably over fences and an extended 2m7f on latest, but back hurdling today with overall improvement needed in first-time headgear; all starts on soft except for one modest show on good to soft.

runners.name: Pearls Pirate
runners.comment: 15l eighth of 13 on handicap debut at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft; 7-1); cheekpieces now
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way on first three starts over hurdles and it was 15l when eighth of 13 on handicap debut at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft; 7-1) 18 days ago; needs to show something new, with cheekpieces enlisted.

4:55.race_name: Smith And Western Hoedown Handicap Hurdle
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +12yds)

runners.name: Lord Maher
runners.comment: Won Irish maiden on rules debut last June; soundly beaten both British starts; h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Won a Roscommon maiden hurdle (extended 1m7f, good) on rules debut last June; soundly beaten on both British starts, admittedly at 66-1 over C&D on latest start, so that form may not look too bad, but markedly better is needed on this handicap debut.

runners.name: Ilitch
runners.comment: First start since wind surgery when good 2nd of seven off this mark at Warwick (2m, good)
runners.spotlight: First start since wind surgery when good second of seven off this mark under Murray Dodd at Warwick (2m, good) 19 days ago, coming from the back and he might be able to build on that performance.

runners.name: Copper Cove
runners.comment: Step back in right direction here latest, despite looking stretched by the extended 2m3f
runners.spotlight: 1-11 over hurdles, the win delivered at this course last February on heavy going; just 1lb higher today and he took a step back in the right direction when third here (good to soft) on latest start, despite looking stretched by the extended 2m3f, so he needs a second look.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely individual who wants soft ground. He'll start over hurdles over two and a half miles at a nice galloping track like Ffos Las, Chepstow or Exeter. He's a nice horse who wants fences really next year. 25-10-22

runners.name: Call To Duty
runners.owner: Mrs N Turner & Mrs E Fenton
runners.comment: Pulled up in a 2m3f handicap in November when last seen; given wind surgery soon after
runners.spotlight: Close up in a 2m2f Stratford novice (good) last June but on the slide since and he pulled up in a 2m3f handicap in November when last seen; given wind surgery soon afterwards and not entirely dismissed.

stable_tour.quote: Third in a good bumper at Taunton at the end of last season, he's always shown plenty at home. We decided to run him in the bumper at Cheltenham's October meeting first time out this season and the occasion was just too much for him. He pulled for a mile and a half and then fell in a hole. What it did do was take the freshness out of him and we'll go novice hurdling and keep things low key. I still think he can be a very nice novice this season. 22-11-23

runners.name: Sambezi
runners.breeder: Alban Chevalier Du Fau Et Al
runners.comment: Three wins (from 24 starts) over hurdles, the latest in May 2023; another career-low mark
runners.spotlight: Three wins (from 24 starts) over hurdles, the latest at Worcester in May 2023 (2m4f, good); bits of 2024 form make appeal, given another career-low mark, but others have more pressing claims.

stable_tour.quote: He had an improved run when eighth at Chepstow last time. He's dropped 1lb and we'll bring him back down to his own handicap level, where hopefully he can get his head in front again. He was running in a 0-115 race last time and it was encouraging. 18-12-24

runners.name: Calshot Spit
runners.comment: C&D winner; not seen since December but he's one to consider if okay for fitness
runners.spotlight: Won by a neck off 1lb lower over C&D (good to soft) last September, hot on the heels of a 2m1f Flat win on good; well held in fifth when he blundered two out at Windsor in December and he's not been seen since, but one to consider if okay for fitness.

runners.name: Soigneux Bell
runners.comment: Went down by more than 40l in his two handicaps this season; headgear change today
runners.spotlight: French Flat winner who landed a 2m2f juvenile hurdle here on heavy ground last winter; went down by more than 40l in his two handicaps this season, however; wore cheekpieces and tongue-tie for the first time on latest start, while blinkers feature today.

stable_tour.quote: He wants slow ground and a stiff track to be seen at his best. He bolted up on heavy ground at Fontwell in December and that's probably what he wants. He wasn't quite right after the Chatteris Fen and didn't run again but he could be nicely handicapped off his current mark. 29-10-24

runners.name: Ugo Bingo

prev_owners.owner: A K Hosie J P Romans W Van Der Horst

runners.comment: On the up on good to soft for A Charlton; more to give for new yard if the ground is okay
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles in 15-runner handicap at Taunton (2m3f) in November and readily doubled his tally in another big field at Wincanton (1m7f, again good to soft) on Boxing Day; good fourth of 16 at Taunton (2m3f) in January and has since left Tony Charlton; ridden by 7lb claimer on last three starts; more to give if the ground is okay.

runners.name: Roi De Baviere
runners.comment: Needs to bounce back from heavy defeat when tongue tied for h'cap hurdle debut (2m, heavy)
runners.spotlight: In the frame in four of 11 Flat runs in France; switched to hurdles by new connections and came second or third in three small fields, but he needs to bounce back from a heavy defeat when tongue tied for handicap hurdle debut (2m, heavy; 12-1) in February.

runners.name: I Love You Sivola

prev_owners.owner: Mlle Lisa Charital, Ecurie Thomas Sivadier & Michael Rizieri
Mlle Lisa Charital, B Sivadier & Ecurie Michael Rizieri
Pierrick Belley, L Viel Et Al

runners.comment: First hurdle race since 2023; visor is a new form of headgear; 6lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his France chasing win of 2022; mostly disappointing this term and switches to hurdles for first time since November 2023; today's visor is a new form of headgear; 6lb out of the handicap.

5:37.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: Diamondonthehill
runners.comment: 7yo who is 0-7 on AW but he's been running well this year; respected
runners.spotlight: Five-time turf winner who is 0-7 on AW but he's been running well this year and was second behind as major improver who surged clear at Southwell (7f) two weeks ago; should be in the mix again back on Polytrack.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit frustrating because he's got a lot more ability than he cares to show. The race didn't really pan out and they didn't go quick enough for him at Haydock last time when he finished seventh of nine. On his previous start at Thirsk he travelled like the best horse. He moved into contention and I think he would have won if he'd just put his best foot forward, but he finished second, beaten a neck by Cerulean Bay. He has a lot of ability if he'd just use it all. He's entered at Thirsk on Friday. 28-08-24

runners.name: Batal Dubai
runners.comment: C&D win in December but he was laboured at Kempton last time and needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D in December and was close second at Southwell (6f) last month but he's not easy to predict and was always in rear at Kempton last time; comes with some risks attached and he's drawn wide back at this track.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: I needed some luck, but I was on a really capable animal. It was a good bit of placing by Harry and Roger because Batal Dubai was in great form and improved from Windsor. I thought with a bit of luck we'd win the whole way. He went to the start sweetly and I didn't have to fight him at any stage. He's a horse with a future and the weight-for-age isn't massive, but it has helped him - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Brasil Power
runners.comment: Four AW wins over 7f and he could be dangerous dropped back in trip and grade
runners.spotlight: All four wins over 7f on AW and latest was at Kempton last August; been a bit up and down since then but he went close at Kempton on his penultimate run and ran respectably when returned to 1m there last time; now only 2lb higher than for last win and has possibilities back in trip.

quotes.race: Unibet More Boosts In More Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Brasil Power was drawn 13 and George Boughey left it up to me. It was only in the stalls that I decided to drop him in and I'm surprised how quickly he got to the front. He's obviously a horse with ability and he likes the AW. It was a good performance - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

runners.name: Lerwick
runners.comment: Runner-up on Tapeta in two of his last three runs; could make a bold bid for new yard
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been on turf but he's still lightly raced on AW and was runner-up at Southwell (1m) and Newcastle (7f) in two of his last three runs for Edward Bethell; changed hands for 23,000gns this month and it wouldn't be a surprise if he made a bold bid for new yard.

stable_tour.quote: He showed plenty of promise last year in three runs over a mile, finishing second twice. First time out this year at Haydock, he was probably a bit fresh and finished fourth of the 14 runners over a mile, but he's much better than that. I would suggest readers keep on the right side of him as I think he's on a very decent mark. He's fine over a mile but I can see him doing all right over 1m2f. 01-06-23

runners.name: Rey De La Batalla
runners.comment: Won over C&D last month and he went close over 1m here last time; key player
runners.spotlight: Four good runs from five starts (all here) since he returned to action in December, including a C&D win last month and a close call over 1m last time; up another 2lb but he still looks feasibly treated and is open to more progress; key player.

runners.name: Tadreeb
runners.comment: Three C&D wins for new yard and was runner-up at Kempton (1m) latest; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 7yo who was resurgent with C&D wins in his first three runs for Rod Millman; has come up short in last two runs but he chased home a well-handicapped rival at Kempton (1m) last time and he's respected back at this trip.

quotes.race: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: Tadreeb is obviously in very good form and we've been very lucky to inherit him, as he's a very nice horse. He's got very good back form and was quite classy in his day. Michael [Attwater, previous trainer] did very well with him, but sometimes a change of yard can just perk them up again. We'll be looking at running him here next week - Rod Millman, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud Partners Of The AWC Handicap
quotes.quote: Tadreeb has to be ridden like that and it was a muddling pace. I think the plan is to run him on Good Friday if the handicapper allows. He could be a nice type for the turf - William Carson, rider.

runners.name: Intervention
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: On dangerous mark and ran well from tough draw at Wolverhampton last time; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: That last of his ten AW wins was in December 2023 but that was off 8lb higher and he ran well when third from a tough draw at Wolverhampton (7f) three weeks ago; has claims if he can build on that and he's a dual course winner.

quotes.race: Win Â£2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic win again and Intervention is just an amazing horse. That's eleven wins since we bought him, his last four on the bounce. He's going on seven, in the form of his life and is better than ever. It secures at least sharing the top prize for the all-weather horse of the month at the Arc (Arena Racing Company) tracks in December because that's three wins from his last three runs. We're thrilled with him, he came to us as a longstanding maiden and Mick's just worked wonders with him. He's a bit of a hero of ours, he's won more races for us than any other horse and he's a firm favourite - Chris Dixon, syndicate boss.

stable_tour.quote: Our winningmost horse with 11 victories. He had quite a few goes before we bought him and he's won all those races for us and well over Â£100,000 in prize-money. He's just a legend. He runs his race nearly every time and always seems to be in the money. He's come down to a good mark again for the all-weather season and he's ready to win again soon. He's having a break now and usually thrives through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.name: My Awele
runners.comment: Both wins at sprint trips and she still has stamina to prove over 7f; down the list
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been in sprint handicaps at Southwell but she's not made an impact over 6f in her last two runs; needs to raise her game again and she still has stamina to prove at this trip; tongue-tie added.

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: We're very happy, particularly as My Awele had a bad pelvic fracture last year and it has taken a long time to nurse her back to full health - Conrad Allen, trainer.

3:22.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB)

runners.name: Tatmeen
runners.comment: Didn't look devoid of ability when a remote 4th over 1m here on debut; drop in trip a ?
runners.spotlight: Showed a glimmer of promise amidst his inexperience when fourth in a 1m maiden on debut here three weeks ago; that was slowly run though and dropping back in trip isn't sure to suit.

runners.name: Dragon God
runners.comment: Promise amidst inexperience over C&D on debut in November; bred to need more of a test
runners.spotlight: In need of the experience when down the field in a C&D novice in November; can leave that behind in time but bred to need more of a test.

runners.name: Key Witness
runners.comment: 62,000euros breeze-up 2yo; half-brother to 3 winners (2 of them useful); likely type
runners.spotlight: 110,000euros yearling, 62,000euros breeze-up 2yo; half-brother to winners Power Of States (1m-11.5f including/AW/France; RPR 106), Panama Red (7f-8.5f including Listed/US; 102) and Copake (9.4f AW; 69); dam a fair maiden (83); lots to like on paper and stable can ready a newcomer.

runners.name: The Hrse Horse
runners.comment: Hung badly left in the straight when 5th of 6 on recent debut; this is weaker, at least
runners.spotlight: Looked a hard ride (hung badly left in the home straight) when fifth of six on his recent Wolverhampton debut (7f); that was a stronger race than this, however, and he's open to improvement.

runners.name: Muy Muy Loco
runners.comment: Well beaten in two maiden runs last summer; gelded since and now tried in a hood
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two maidens last summer (6f, good and 7f, Polytrack); gelded prior to his reappearance and now tried in a hood; lots to prove.

runners.name: Virtue Patience
runners.comment: Promise in a good race on debut; tough task at Goodwood when last seen; sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise when fifth of eight in a 6f novice at Salisbury on his debut last June (useful form); slowly away on that occasion and again when never in the hunt in a 6f maiden at Glorious Goodwood the following month; has an eight-month absence to overcome but he's bred to stay and that debut effort is the best form on offer.

runners.name: Dianarina
runners.comment: Prominent for a long way on her debut in France in November (7.5f, heavy); drawn widest
