runners.spotlight: Prominent for a long way on her debut at Saint-Cloud last November (7.5f, heavy), dropping away in the final furlong; drawn wide ahead of her British debut but should last longer this time.

runners.name: Saguaro Blossom
runners.comment: 55,000gns half-sister to two winners out of a well-related mare; check the betting
runners.spotlight: 18,500euros foal, 55,000gns yearling; half-sister to winners Takarengo (1m4f-2m; RPR 91) and Herewegodandy (Scandinavian 5.8f-7f); dam a maiden half-sister to three Group winners; starts off in an uncompetitive race and she needs a market check.

runners.name: Huggable
runners.comment: Dam a modest maiden but from a good family; yard in form; one to consider
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam a maiden out of a well-connected winner in Australia; starts out in a modest event and she is her in-form stable's first runner for the owner; one to consider.

runners.name: Iconnic
runners.comment: First foal of a minor 7f winner; starts out at modest level but others look more appealing
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 7f winner (RPR 72), herself from a useful sprinting family; starts out at a realistic level but others bring stronger paper claims.

runners.name: Dance No More
runners.comment: Couldn't land a blow in a steadily-run 1m maiden at Southwell on debut; drop in trip a ?
runners.spotlight: Plugged on for fifth in a 1m maiden at Southwell two weeks ago, unable to land a telling blow in a steadily-run affair; not sure to benefit from the drop in trip.

runners.name: Lambournghini
runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling; sixth foal of a Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner; betting to guide
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; sixth foal; dam a Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner, herself from a useful family; betting to guide.

2:52.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: Piranha Rama
runners.comment: On last winning mark but she's lost her way recently and needs a major revival
runners.spotlight: Triple 6f winner, who was runner-up at Wolverhampton (7f) last month but her form has slumped in two subsequent runs; now back on last winning but she's not easy to predict and needs a major revival.

runners.name: Francis Drake
runners.comment: Unexposed handicap newcomer and he looks interesting on this drop in trip
runners.spotlight: Well held in his first two runs last month and he got closer to the target when a front-running fourth in 1m maiden here three weeks ago; that was a promising effort and he's an interesting contender now dropped in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Summer Of Light
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden and has something to prove on return for new yard; hood added
runners.spotlight: Placed in two heavy-ground nurseries (5.7f/7f) in October but she struggled in her final two runs for Michael Wigham last year; record now stands at 0-7 and has something to prove on return for new yard; hood added.

runners.name: Belabambina
runners.comment: Showed promise at Wolverhampton last time and she's in the mix on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Plenty of improvement switched to AW after a break when close sixth in Wolverhampton novice (7f) 25 days ago; that was only her third run and she should have more to offer now switched to handicaps; in the mix.

runners.name: Spoilt
runners.comment: 125-1 second in C&D maiden latest; dangerous if she can build on that on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in first two runs but she found lots of progress when 125-1 second in C&D maiden last month; that was eyecatching from off the pace and has possibilities if she can build on that on handicap debut.

runners.name: Private Island
runners.comment: Well-bred filly and she looks a possible improver on handicap debut; needs a close look
runners.spotlight: Well held when down the field in her three qualifying runs (7f/6f) but it's still early days for this well-bred filly and it wouldn't be a surprise if she showed a lot more on this handicap debut; needs close look after a short break.

runners.name: Hidden Verse
runners.comment: Now gelded and goes handicapping but he needs a transformation after 217 days off
runners.spotlight: Well held in three runs last summer, with his best effort an 8l fourth of seven at Epsom (7f, good to firm); has been gelded and now goes handicapping but he needs a transformation after 217 days off; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Risk
runners.comment: Reached the frame in last three runs but is now 0-8 and needs to find more in new headgear
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame in handicaps (6f-1m) in last three runs but he tends to be sluggish in the early stages of his races and is still a maiden after eight starts; new headgear now goes on and he needs to find more back in trip.

runners.name: Broadhaven Bay
runners.comment: Disappointing in final 2yo run and has bit to prove back up to 7f on her return
runners.spotlight: Last-gasp winner when 9-1 on nursery debut at Brighton (5.3f, good to firm) last August but he was disappointing back there (6f) in final 2yo run; still lightly raced but has bit to prove now switched to AW after 208 days off.

runners.name: Ceira G
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford and looked unlucky in her follow-up bid at Wolverhampton; big player
runners.spotlight: Off the mark (fifth attempt) when finishing well to land a Chelmsford handicap (7f) last month and she looked unlucky in her follow-up bid at Wolverhampton 17 days ago; only 1lb higher than for that near miss and she's a big player if she gets the breaks.

4:32.race_name: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.name: Solar Edge
runners.comment: Two 5f nursery wins last year, including here; could yet rate higher as a 3yo
runners.spotlight: The winner of two 5f nurseries last year, including C&D; could have more to offer this season and he's not discounted from a good stall.

runners.name: Horus
runners.comment: 6f win here in December was followed by two solid efforts; progress halted the last twice
runners.spotlight: Well backed prior to winning a 6f nursery here on New Year's Eve; progress has stalled the last twice though and he has a bit more to prove back at 5f; stable also run Commendation.

runners.name: Commendation
runners.comment: Made a winning stable debut over C&D last month; no progress in two runs since
runners.spotlight: Improved effort when making a winning stable debut over C&D last month (cheekpieces first time); no progress in two subsequent runs, albeit she made some headway from a poor position here on Monday (6f); one of two runners for the stable.

runners.name: Bow Street
runners.comment: 6f win in November; satisfactory return at Southwell last month; needs more back at 5f
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f nursery at Newcastle in November; gelded prior to his creditable fifth at Southwell on his return to action six weeks ago; drops back in trip and he'll need a good pace to run at.

runners.name: Over Spiced
runners.comment: Bright start for this yard but her form has cooled more recently; others are stronger
runners.spotlight: Hit the frame on her first three runs for this yard but her form has cooled more recently; down in the weights but others bring more pressing claims.

runners.name: Early Release
runners.comment: 6f win on stable debut in Dec; two good runs followed but below par last week; wide draw
runners.spotlight: Made a winning stable debut at Southwell (6f) in December; two good runs folloiwed, including over C&D, but he wasn't at his best at Southwell last week; drawn widest which won't help matters.

runners.name: Natsumi
runners.breeder: The Out Of The Flames Partnership
runners.comment: 5f win at Chelmsford in November before a C&D second to Solar Edge; below par last time
runners.spotlight: Made a winning nursery debut at Chelmsford (5f; tongue tied for the first time) in November; chased home Solar Edge over C&D one month later but she turned in a lacklustre display at Southwell ten days later; returns from a break with Rossa Ryan retaining the ride; still has low mileage.

runners.name: Kodibeat
runners.comment: Poor form for L Mullaney last autumn but tumbled down weights; new yard try a visor
runners.spotlight: Came to hand early for the Coles as a 2yo, including a 5f Polytrack win on debut; poor form in three runs for Lawrence Mullaney last autumn but dropped 11lb as a result; starts out for new yard (same owners) with a visor fitted and she's one to note for market confidence.

quotes.race: Unibet Support Safe Gambling/EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kodibeat is bred to be very quick but I told the owners I thought she'd come on for the run. We haven't really wound her up because we haven't been on the grass this year so it's a bit of guesswork coming here. I don't think she'll ever be a big filly and the jockey said that getting her out on soft ground would be a good idea - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Toolatetonegotiate
runners.comment: Running creditably in minor AW handicaps this winter; minor money perhaps her best hope
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden but she has run some sound races since handicapping, including around here; suspicion others will prove better handicapped this time though.

2:22.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Amateur Jockeys' Handicap

runners.name: French Martini
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Oliver Piraud Et Al
runners.comment: Came good with 4l win at Bath (2m) in October; respected back in trip on her return
runners.spotlight: Seems effective with and without a hood; no win in first 11 runs but, after wind surgery, she came good with a 4l success under David Dunsdon at Bath (2m1f, soft) in October; this is a big drop back in trip but she's only 3lb higher than last time and was runner-up over 1m4f in the autumn; respected on return.

runners.name: Throne Hall
runners.comment: Has lost her way under both codes and needs a major revival back on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner split between hurdling and the Flat, but she's been out of sorts under both codes since October including two tailed-off efforts over hurdles last month; cheekpieces return but has lots to prove and needs a major revival back in this sphere.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Throne Hall has been a tricky horse, he looked like he was going to be pretty good over hurdles, he beat a good horse of Nigel Twiston-Davies' at Wetherby, but he basically hasn't turned up since. He's not straightforward but the soft ground helped him today. It's great to see him back to form - Archie Watson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He looks like he should be suited by stepping up in trip. Sheikh Obaid [owner] mentioned this race straight after York and he's an exciting contender. If he does stay, he could be the one for the Ebor. 10-06-21

runners.name: Sea Of Charm

prev_owners.owner: The Turf Club & Mrs Harry Dunlop

runners.comment: Ordinary strike-rate of 3-47 but she's generally reliable and is not ruled out on return
runners.spotlight: Ordinary strike-rate of 3-47 but her last win was over this trip at Wolverhampton (off 3lb lower) in September and she is generally reliable; returns after 160 days off but she's in the mix for in-form yard.

runners.name: Royal Observatory
runners.comment: His form dropped off at Newcastle last time and still has stamina to prove at this trip
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough at Chelmsford (1m2f) in December and has had a couple of near misses since but he didn't fire with cheekpieces added at Newcastle last time; bit to prove again after that and he's struggled in three previous runs at this trip.

runners.name: Fravanco
runners.breeder: Mrs L N Harmes & Mr M Willis
runners.comment: Won at Kempton in September but he's struggled on the Flat and over hurdles last twice
runners.spotlight: Scored off 1lb lower at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) in September but he's not gone on from that and was tailed off on his hurdling debut at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) three weeks ago; others preferred.

runners.name: Dubai Harbour
runners.comment: Two wins here during the winter and he looks worth a try at this new trip; key player
runners.spotlight: Had a productive time on Polytrack during the winter including two wins at this track (1m2f); his last success was by a nose last month but he's only 2lb higher here and has shaped as though this new trip should be within range; key player with Simon Walker booked.

stable_tour.quote: This homebred colt is quite big but he has a lovely attitude, and I'd not be surprised if he turns out to be useful. We'll start off over 6f or 7f, but not until the second half of the season. 13-04-22

runners.name: Bloodhound
runners.comment: 0-14 but was runner-up at Wolverhampton in January and has possibilities on that form
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden who was well held at Wolverhampton (1m4f) last time but he finished second there on his penultimate run and has possibilities if he can recapture that form; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: National Health
runners.comment: 0-15 but he's been placed in five of his last six runs including over C&D on Monday
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after 15 starts but he's been placed in five of his last six runs including when a 2l third over C&D (classified event) on Monday; usually comes from off the pace and could be a big factor back in a handicap.

runners.name: Mapogo

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Kathy Carter & Mrs Margaret Elliott

runners.comment: Regressive 17-race maiden who has been out of form since last spring; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Regressive 17-race maiden who has been out of form since last spring and was tailed off at Chelmsford (1m5f) last time; can only be watched.

runners.name: Global Style
runners.comment: Missed last year and was out the back at Southwell on recent comeback; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Triple winner (including over C&D) but he missed last year and was out the back at Southwell (1m) on recent comeback for new yard; this big step back up in trip looks a good move but he's in the veteran stage now and needs to leave that latest form well behind; visor added.

quotes.race: Star Sports Best Odds Guaranteed Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: The race fell apart a bit, but Global Style was well placed in this contest. He's always had some ability, but he just needed those in front to fall back - Tony Carroll, trainer.

5:07.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Combustion
runners.comment: 3-3 since dropped to 6f; this demands further progress but it could be forthcoming
runners.spotlight: Remote in his first three starts but he's 3-3 since dropping in trip and tackling classified company; needs a step forward now handicapping off his revised mark but further progress could be forthcoming.

runners.name: Silky Robin
runners.comment: 15-race maiden but he'd been threatening prior to a poor run latest; drawn widest
runners.spotlight: 0-15 but there have been some near misses this year; disappointed when favourite at Chelmsford three weeks ago and he's landed the outside stall this afternoon.

runners.name: Piperstown
runners.comment: Four wins since December, including both times he's been ridden by Rossa Ryan; contender
runners.spotlight: Something of slow burner but he's got his act together over the winter, winning four times since December; 2-2 when ridden by Rossa Ryan and seems likely to give another good account.

runners.name: Mehmo

prev_owners.owner: Winterbeck Stud, T Bownes & G Kelleway

runners.comment: Solid efforts the last twice but he needs more to overcome a wide draw
runners.spotlight: Two encouraging runs for his new yard this year, not seen to best effect at Wolverhampton last time (finished a neck behind Miss Moonshine); drawn wide and others make more appeal.

runners.name: Agent Mayfair
runners.comment: Comes here in good form but not sure to reverse latest placings with Combustion
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when making all at Southwell (5f) last month; similar form when chasing home Combustion at Chelmsford (6f) ten days later; 5lb better off today but it might not be enough.

runners.name: Colorada Dancer
runners.comment: Placed over 7f last month but well held either side of it; new trip today
runners.spotlight: Placed over 7f on his second run for new connections but well held either side of it and now drops in trip.

runners.name: Lynwood Lad

prev_owners.owner: P Simpson, D Tierney, J Portman

runners.comment: Latest 7f run excusable; earlier Wolverhampton win brings him into the reckoning
runners.spotlight: Can be given a pass for latest run as 7f has looked to stretch him in the past; earlier 6f win at Wolverhampton brings him into the reckoning.

runners.name: Miss Moonshine
runners.comment: Conditions to suit & placed all 4 times Hollie Doyle has ridden her; now gets cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Conditions to suit (two C&D wins to her name) and although it has been a while since her last success she has gone close the last twice that Hollie Doyle has ridden her; cheekpieces now given a go; one to consider.

runners.name: Lilkian
runners.comment: Near miss over C&D in January but he hasn't kicked on since
runners.spotlight: Went close over C&D in January but that hasn't proven a springboard to better things; others preferred for win purposes.

runners.name: Dont Fight It
runners.comment: Conditions no problem and she holds each-way claims if taking her chance
runners.spotlight: Dual winner over 5f on turf for Keith Dalgleish as a 2yo and not beaten far in 6f Polytrack handicaps in three of her last five starts; more minor money could be forthcoming if taking her chance (non-runner seven times since joining this yard).

runners.name: Barnsnape Boy
runners.comment: 0-11 and although he has hinted at ability, others look safer for win purposes
runners.spotlight: 0-11 and although he has hinted at ability, others look safer for win purposes.

3:57.race_name: BetUK: It's Where The UK Bets Handicap

runners.name: Midnightattheoasis
runners.comment: Chasing a quick hat-trick and this could be run to suit him; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Comes here chasing a quick hat-trick and although he's 5lb worse off with Pop Dancer for just a neck on their Newcastle run on Tuesday, he might be well suited by how this is likely to be run; Rossa Ryan retains the ride; the one to beat.

runners.name: Dream By Day
runners.comment: Regressive this winter but this might be run to suit and he's dropped down the weights
runners.spotlight: Freegoing sort who should appreciate the likely strong pace; dropped a long way in the weights and a big run could be forthcoming.

quotes.race: Racing TV Extra Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Dream By Day was a bit disappointing on his stable debut but made his way nicely into this. He travelled so well and picked up on the ground before idling late on. He's quite lightly raced and will get better with racing - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Pop Dancer

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Dangerous mark and ran well at Newcastle on Tuesday; other pace to deal with this time
runners.spotlight: On a dangerous mark and he made a bold bid at Newcastle on Tuesday, unable to hold the late challenge of the reopposing Midnightatheoasis; 5lb better off for a neck today but likely to face competition up front and the placings may be upheld.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Pop Dancer would win first time and it was just greenness that beat him. He did it well today - assistant trainer Robin O'Ryan.

runners.name: Forest Gunner
runners.comment: No real impact in either handicap start; down in weights but others look safer
runners.spotlight: His standout effort came in a small-field novice at Wolverhampton in January and two handicap runs since have been less positive; edging down the weights but others have stronger claims.

runners.name: Rebel Star
runners.comment: Good 2nd on recent handicap debut; still low mileage but perhaps not straightforward
runners.spotlight: Appeared to show improvement on her handicap debut at Wolverhampton ten days ago (5f; visored first time); not sure how deep that race was but she does at least bring untapped potential.

runners.name: Lion Ring
runners.comment: Four wins last autumn, including C&D; solid run latest but other pace to deal with today
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a purple patch last autumn, winning four times (including C&D); respectable third at Chelmsford three weeks ago; other pace to contend with this time.

runners.name: Unavailable
runners.comment: 6f win here in December; struggled in Class 5 here latest; new accessories today
runners.spotlight: Reportedly aided by a tongue tie when winning a 6f handicap here in December; respectable C&D fourth next time but she was well beaten here three weeks ago, albeit in stronger company; tongue-tie absent today and cheekpieces are replaced by new blinkers.

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Last time it was six, but we know Unavailable has the speed for five and the cheekpieces obviously worked. She's run a huge race. The second has done as well - it's a shame they had to run in the same race. She just needs a bit of guidance and the cheekpieces do the job - Chelsea Banham, trainer.

runners.name: Suanni
runners.comment: Two good runs at Wolverhampton the last twice; another big run expected from a handy draw
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; knocking at the door at Wolverhampton of late, second last month and then running a fine race for third back there 11 days ago when setting a strong pace and only picked off late; well drawn and another big run looks assured.

runners.name: Battle Point
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate and held in classified events so far this year; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Poor strike-rate and he has been comfortably held in classified events this year; others look stronger.

6:15.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: An Bradan Feasa
runners.comment: Fair hurdler at best; unsuccessful in current jumps campaign; second Flat attempt
runners.spotlight: Fair juvenile hurdler in the 2023-24 season but unsuccessful in the current jumps campaign, latterly over fences; returns to the Flat for first time since midfield debut effort when trained in Ireland.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Fred Winter is what we discussed two or three weeks ago. An Bradan Feasa would be 50-1 in a Triumph Hurdle, but although he will go up again today he would have a competitive enough weight in the Fred Winter. He will have a quiet enough time now and he will have one more run before March and see where we end up. He is very easy to ride, and Tom said he is an absolute delight. It (the Fred Winter) wouldn't be any bother to him. He has sat third there today and you could let him sit mid division to the rear in the Fred Winter and let him travel away  - Jack Jones, trainer.

runners.name: Superposition
runners.comment: Had wind/gelding operations since last run; leading player on his 2yo efforts
runners.spotlight: Came up short in a handicap in sole outing last term; had wind/gelding operations since; leading player on his 2yo efforts, including a third-place finish at this venue; market may offer further assistance.

runners.name: Fighting Queen
runners.breeder: H H Shaikh Nasser Bin Hamad Al Khalifa
runners.comment: Late headway over 7f at Wolverhampton; may improve over this extra furlong
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 1m AW winner; friendless in the betting but showed some promise with her late headway, without landing a blow, in 7f contest at Wolverhampton; may do better over this extra furlong.

runners.name: Deep Water Bay
runners.comment: The type to do better when handicapping, probably over further
runners.spotlight: Always in rear in a couple of C&D novice events; the type to do better when handicapping, probably over longer trips.

runners.name: Erick
runners.owner: West Shaw Farm Ltd & Gary White
runners.comment: Stable not associated with winning newcomers
runners.spotlight: Eqtidaar gelding who is out of an unraced half-sister to winners Emeralds Pride (6f) and Snowball Jackson (French 6.5f-1m); stable not associated with winning newcomers.

runners.name: Fosroc
runners.comment: Showed promise in two contests last term, latest behind a useful sort; respected
runners.spotlight: $335,000 yearling; showed promise in two 7f novice events on Polytrack last term, latest at Kempton where he beat all bar an impressive winner who looks useful; likely to stay this longer distance; respected.

runners.name: Go Out
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De La Perelle
runners.comment: Ran to a modest RPR at Newcastle but should do better; half-brother to 11 winners
runners.spotlight: Ran to a modest RPR in uncompetitive 7f race at Newcastle, finishing third; however, this half-brother to 11 winners is open to improvement with the outing/experience under his belt.

runners.name: Killenaule
runners.comment: Close third over 1m at Lingfield in sole run for Ollie Sangster; possibilities
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 1m winner; overcame a tardy start to finish a close third over this trip at Lingfield in sole run for Ollie Sangster; possibilities, provided that promise is confirmed for new yard.

runners.name: Kingmaker
runners.comment: Gives the impression handicaps will be more suitable shortly
runners.spotlight: Second autumn effort was better than the first but he gives the impression handicaps will be more suitable shortly; perhaps best watched unless the betting speaks positively.

runners.name: Looks Fantastic
runners.comment: Didn't live up to expectations at Doncaster but is open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Didn't live up to expectations, having attracted support, in big field on soft ground at Doncaster five months ago; gelded since; evidently thought capable of better and this surface may be more suitable.

runners.name: Wootton Palace
runners.comment: Could step up on Sandown effort in this easier-looking event
runners.spotlight: Likely had a difficult task in Sandown maiden (7f) last August and didn't fare badly in the circumstances, finishing midfield; could take a step forward in this easier-looking event.

runners.name: Make A Note
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in both starts
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form, having been soundly beaten in both starts.

5:15.race_name: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Maghlaak
runners.comment: Returns to Flat from hurdles; something to prove in first 2m attempt under this code
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner at up to 1m2f for previous yard and dual hurdles scorer for current stable (below par last time); something to prove in first 2m attempt under this code.

quotes.race: William Hill More Top Prices Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I'd say Maghlaak is going to be a decent horse, jumping will toughen him up. His bit of class showed there late on and he did that well.  We bought him as a dual-purpose horse and he has a great pedigree - his dam won the Guineas - Adrian Keatley, trainer

quotes.race: Golf At Goodwood Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Maghlaak had a lot of weight, so did it well. I've no idea about plans - Jim Crowley, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He finished well to win at Goodwood on his comeback, but he was drawn ten of ten at Redcar last time and could never get any cover. It was a non-event and I'm putting a line through it. He's a pretty talented horse, who likes to get his toe in, and I think the mile and a half would suit him well if he makes the cut. 13-06-24

He has a fabulous pedigree, being by our great sprinter Muhaarar out of our brilliant Guineas and Coronation winner Ghanaati. He's relatively lightly raced with two wins from just five runs and there's still a nice bit more to come from him. His latest run, when second in a 1m2f Haydock handicap late last month, was a very good run as we bumped into Spirit Of The Bay, who showed a very good turn of foot. That was on good to firm, but he has also run well in very soft conditions, so ground is never a worry. I suppose if it were to come up with some dig underfoot it might be more of a benefit to him than most of the others in the Duke of Edinburgh on Friday. If it was rattling quick, we might have a decision to make but he's pretty versatile and going the right way. 21-06-23

runners.name: Charging Thunder
runners.comment: Won at Yarmouth on debut for new yard and is 2-3 over hurdles since; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Regained the winning thread at Yarmouth (1m6f) on debut for new yard and is 2-3 over hurdles since; still favourably treated on historical data and enters calculations returned to this code.

quotes.race: Moulton Nurseries Handicap
quotes.quote: I bought Charging Thunder on spec and sold him about an hour before the race, so it's all gone well. He was a good horse back in his day and has slipped into the lowest grade he's run in for a while. We've schooled him and he's taken to that quite well. He was going to go hurdling next, but after today we might change our mind, although he'll see a hurdle at some point - trainer James Owen speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Brampton Manor Handicap
quotes.quote: It's tough over and mile and six for these horses but Charging Thunder has toughed it out - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Bet 10Get20 Promo Code Chepstow Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Charging Thunder was fit and well coming into today so David was pretty hopeful having brought him all the way down. His form has been pretty consistent and he's got a big stride on him so I've allowed him to get into his rhythm and he's galloped all the way to the line. It was a good effort - David Probert, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He might have been a bit mentally immature for Dubai. A half-brother to Makawee and Prince Of Arran, who both got better with age, he could make the jump up to Pattern company once he grows up and stops hanging and getting hot. He wants top of the ground and could start off in a handicap at York. 04-05-23

runners.name: Circuit Breaker
runners.comment: Hindered by steady pace last time; solid record otherwise on AW; place possibilities
runners.spotlight: Hindered by steady pace back down in trip last time; solid record (133) otherwise on AW and ran creditably over C&D in February when switched back to the Flat from hurdles; place possibilities.

quotes.race: Try Unibet's Improved Bet Builder Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Circuit Breaker had a really tough trip at Hamilton last time and it was all too much for him. I had to leave him alone after that and, with the size of his feet, he wants a bit of juice in the ground. He might be one for the final of this series and I'm glad I've got him back on track - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a funny race with just four runners that he won at Kempton, but we always expected him to come on for that run. He's an out-and-out stayer and maybe something like the River Don in the spring might be an option. He cost plenty from the Flat but jumped well at Kempton and should continue to improve. 06-11-24

runners.name: Legendary Day
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd

prev_owners.owner: Keatley Racing Owners Group & D Moore

runners.comment: Well held here last month, failing to back up the form of his 66-1 win at Lingfield
runners.spotlight: Well behind Circuit Breaker when a 16-1 shot here last month, failing to back up the form of his 66-1 success at Lingfield; not solid and not the percentage call.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: The ground is too soft for Legendary Day over hurdles, he wants good or good to soft ground - David Gibbons, owner.

quotes.race: Prestige Safety 'Your Trusted Safety Partner' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Legendary Day had a couple of ordinary runs on the Flat so we schooled him over fences as we always felt he'd go well chasing. His schooling was good and he was up to the task there against experienced handicappers. He's consistent and whichever discipline he's winning in, we'll keep running him in - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Mallard Handicap
quotes.quote: I'd been watching Mark Winn for a while, he's a good rider and an astute young man with a good head on his shoulders and I just thought that 3lb would be crucial. Legendary Day was following the fancied one who quickly fell away so he found himself in front and there was nothing he could do. Thankfully it worked - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won back-to-back handicaps last summer off marks in the 70s and has now progressed to a rating of 81. This season he ran a couple of encouraging races before disappointing at Windsor, where I suspect he found the ground too quick for his liking. He must have juice in the ground and we'll look for those conditions next time and drop him back to 1m2f. 13-07-22

runners.name: Pergamon
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Pair & White Birch Farm
runners.comment: Produced form figures of 321 in France; still unexposed; interesting on British debut
runners.spotlight: Produced form figures of 321 in France for Andre Fabre, the success at Dieppe upped to 1m7f; sold for 22,000gns and had wind surgery since; unexposed sort who is interesting on British debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a Frankel three-year-old who'll go on the Flat and then go juvenile hurdling. He was purchased at the horses in training sale from Andre Fabre's yard. He was gelded on arrival to the yard and you won't see him until the back end of January. He's a good staying prospect and is worth looking out for. 05-12-24

runners.name: Wonder
runners.comment: C&D success two weeks ago took his AW record to 14231; respected off unaltered mark
runners.spotlight: Had to work harder than expected to justify favouritism in C&D event (first 2m attempt) two weeks ago but displayed a game attitude and took his AW record to 14231; particularly unexposed at this trip and may still have further improvement in him; respected off unaltered mark.

runners.name: The Craftymaster
runners.owner: S Barton, T Stamp, R Miles, & Partner
runners.comment: 0-10 since his productive spell but went close at Newcastle last time; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Highly productive spell ended with a success off this mark at Newcastle last March; 0-10 since but went close there last time; possibilities if aided by reapplied cheekpieces (second attempt).

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca Handicap
quotes.quote: The Craftymaster has been a revelation. He used to be slow, but stayed. Now, when that was going to turn into a sprint, I was thinking you can't go wide as you'll never win, so just wait and see if you outstay them. He's put them to bed in half a furlong with his injection of speed. He's learning and getting better at everything he does. This was the first test of his mettle, a full field with horses who have been in very good form and he's up to it. I don't feel I'm at the bottom of him yet - I feel if something came at him he'd go again -  William Carson, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: The Craftymaster has developed late and we've been very lucky to have him. He's progressing really nicely. He's going up the grades slowly and he's coping with it. He stays very well and he's lazy through his races, so you'd like to think there's always just a tiny little bit left. We'll keep going forward - Tony Carroll, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Further Measure
runners.comment: Record of 5-6 this year includes three wins at Southwell; 3-3 under Sean Dylan Bowen
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 8yo whose record of 5-6 this year includes three wins at Southwell (3-5 here overall); had more in hand than the narrow margin suggests last time, taking record since being partnered by Sean Dylan Bowen to 3-3; brings excellent stats.

quotes.race: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Sean was further back than ideal and I was panicking a little bit but once Further Measure came up the straight he just kept finding. He's been unlucky in some races when they haven't gone a pace so today was pleasing. He's entered at Wolverhampton on Monday but we'll see how he comes out of this, he's eight now and he's been a great servant for us. We originally bought him for the apprentices to ride and he's at a stage where he's enjoying life so we're all delighted - Mike Murphy, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

5:45.race_name: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Flute Dor
runners.comment: Beaten 10l+ in two Wolverhampton events at about 1m1f; handicaps more likely
runners.spotlight: Beaten 10l+ in two Wolverhampton events at about 1m1f; some signs in pedigree that she'll stay 1m4f but handicaps looking her best option.

runners.name: Regal River
runners.comment: Nicely bred; mild bumper promise; pleasing 3rd over 1m4f at Kempton; can improve
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred filly out of a well-connected mare; just mild promise in two bumpers but she came from off the pace, after being hampered and having to be switched, to take a pleasing third to 70s-rated rivals at Kempton (1m4f) recently; open to improvement and on the premises.

runners.name: Bovey Belle
runners.comment: Trip no problem on pedigree but 250-1 and out with the washing on 1m3f debut here
runners.spotlight: Should have no problem with the trip on pedigree but she was 250-1 and out with the washing on 1m3f debut here last month.

runners.name: Cantalice
runners.comment: Shouldn't fail for want of stamina but never sighted on recent 1m3f debut here
runners.spotlight: Shouldn't fail for want of stamina but was never sighted on recent 1m3f debut on this track (17-2; in these aids, retained); early days.

runners.name: Caspi Star
runners.comment: Showed promise both 2yo starts, looking green each time; may well improve plenty
runners.spotlight: Signs of ability in novice events at Goodwood and Beverley (both about 1m) in the second half of 2024, looking green each time; has good connections and may well be a different proposition as 3yo; market can guide.

runners.name: Kintbury
runners.comment: Smart middle-distance pedigree; game 3rd upped to 1m3f here recently; competitive
runners.spotlight: Smart middle-distance pedigree and she improved from a fairly low-key debut at Wolverhampton when showing a good attitude in third on this track (1m3f) 14 days ago; needs more to win this but competitive again.

runners.name: Lady Vivian
runners.comment: Improved for step up to 1m3f at Southwell when 2nd to good Godolphin prospect; respected
runners.spotlight: Has an Irish Oaks entry; stamina in the family and this one built on a fair 1m debut when runner-up to a good Godolphin prospect over 1m3f on this track, where she came home strongly despite showing inexperience; another step forward expected.

runners.name: La Trinite
runners.comment: Shown some promise in two middle-distance runs at Kempton; handicaps more likely
runners.spotlight: Has shown some promise in two middle-distance starts at Kempton but a handicap win looks more on the agenda than a maiden success.

runners.name: Only One Blue
runners.comment: Well backed for both 1m runs, got going too late at Kempton latest; 1m4f can suit
runners.spotlight: Well backed for both 1m starts, unable to fend off a promising newcomer of the Crisfords on this track and then she couldn't get going until too late at Kempton (odds-on) in January; however, she has plenty of staying power on the dam's side so has to be respected up in trip.

runners.name: Hover On The Wind
runners.comment: Two Yarmouth wins last summer (6f); sold for 18,000gns last October; has gone well fresh
runners.spotlight: Made all to win two 6f handicaps at Yarmouth last summer when trained by Chris Dwyer; sold for 18,000gns in October; has gone well fresh in the past so worth a market check on his first run for 191 days.

runners.name: Twilight Diamond
runners.comment: Two runs in small-field novices, finishing 1st and 2nd; more on his plate now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Contested two 6f four-runner novices this year, winning on debut and showing better form when second under a penalty at Kempton last month; unexposed but has more on his plate now switched to handicap company.

runners.name: Commander Of Life
runners.comment: Running well of late but over further; not sure what to expect back sprinting; yard run 2
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f as a 2yo but raced over 7f+ since the start of 2024, winning an 8.6f handicap at Wolverhampton in January (cheekpieces for the first time); solid runs in defeat the last twice but the drop in distance asks a different question; stable also run Dark Side Thunder.

runners.name: Dark Side Thunder
runners.comment: C&D win off this mark 12 months ago; promising return to action; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: C&D win 12 months ago off the same mark; pleasing return from four months off here last month, keeping on steadily for fourth; each-way claims for a yard that also run Commader Of Life.

runners.name: Cliffcake
runners.comment: C&D win last month was emphatic but less good over 7f latest; easy lead unlikely
runners.spotlight: Good strike-rate and he recorded his 11th win when making all over C&D six weeks ago (cheekpieces on for the first time); taken on up front over 7f last time and weakened in the final furlong; easy lead unlikely here either.

runners.name: Hierarchy
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & Tally Ho Stud
runners.comment: Consistent sprinter but finds winning difficult; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Numerous good efforts since his last win (first past the post at Lingfield in January but weighed in light); should remain competitive.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice last year over 6f and finished second, beaten only a head, in the Group 2 Mill Reef Stakes. He started the year promisingly enough when second to Go Bears Go at Ascot but found life tough at Group 1 level in the Commonwealth Cup, where the ground was far too quick for him. We'll drop him back to handicap company next time and he may go to Newmarket this week. 06-07-22

runners.name: Kats Bob
runners.comment: 2-2 for Ruth Carr, both wins coming over 6f at Newcastle; respected in hat-trick bid
runners.spotlight: 2-2 for Ruth Carr, winning a pair of 6f handicaps at Newcastle; 4lb higher mark to defy in his hat-trick bid and this looks a deeper race than last time; not discounted in current form though.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a break but he's back on the go and training well, ready to run soon. He has his level but he's been a good horse for the yard. He's a genuine 6f horse who handles a bit of dig in the ground and is good on the all-weather. 26-07-24

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark if the addition of blinkers has a galvanising effect
runners.spotlight: Won a division of this race 12 months ago (Cliffcake won the other) off a 12lb higher mark; back to winning ways at Wolverhampton last month but that hasn't been a springboard to better things; possible that the addition of blinkers will give him a lift though.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent all-weather horse and has won at Newcastle and Southwell this month and been second twice. He may switch back to turf but dry ground is quite important to him. When he's right he tries very hard and he's the sort who's important to the yard because he can win two or three a year and if every horse did that you'd have an awful lot of winners. He's entered at Newcastle on Friday. 20-03-24

runners.name: Electric Avenue
runners.comment: Returned from 66-day break to win in December; back form same layoff today
runners.spotlight: Returned from 66-day break to win at Newcastle (1m; stable debut) in December and is back from the same layoff today; one to consider, despite a below-par effort last time.

runners.name: Panama City

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Susan Davis, Mrs Melissa O'Neill & Peter Mitchell

runners.comment: Starts his 2025 campaign on a difficult mark and has never won when fresh
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW scorer, most recently in December (below form later that month); however, starts his 2025 campaign on a difficult mark and has never won when fresh.

runners.name: Waleyfa
runners.comment: Has form figures of 12134 for new stable; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 12134 for new stable, the wins at Brighton but she's a three-time AW scorer previously; creditable fourth at Chelmsford on seasonal debut; solid chance.

runners.name: Thats For Sure

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxiii & E Burke

runners.comment: Signs of a revival at Lingfield last month on stable debut; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Soon lost his way for previous yard but showed signs of a revival with third-place finish at Lingfield (upped to 1m) last month on debut for new stable; enters calculations.

runners.name: Thats My Boy Luke
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden; ran well in first-time cheekpeices at Newcastle most recently
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who ran well in first-time cheekpieces at Newcastle (1m) most recently, finishing a very close third; possibilities off same mark in the retained headgear.

runners.name: Makalu
runners.comment: Failed to transfer his turf form back to AW when last seen
runners.spotlight: Registered sole AW success over C&D (classified event) but has shown best form on turf and failed to transfer it back to this sphere when last seen; others preferred.

quotes.race: Ayr Racecourse Sunday Market Handicap
quotes.quote: Makalu has turned around this year and he seems to be enjoying his racing now. I think he likes dropping in and staying on from the back and it gives him confidence. He's very gutsy when he does get there, he puts his head down and tries - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C & D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Makalu has been a work in progress, I'd imagine he wants seven furlongs really - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won first time out at Southwell a few weeks ago. He did win at Redcar for us last year and that's where we'll go back next. Makalu has come a long way down the handicap - he's only rated 51 now - but on his better form for Kevin Ryan as a two-year-old he was rated 76, and if we can get that sort of form back there's a chance to have a good bit of fun in the meantime. 17-04-24

runners.name: King Of York
runners.owner: A Baker D Slack M Wilson & Partners
runners.comment: Ran well over C&D last week when bidding for a Southwell hat-trick; now 2lb lower
runners.spotlight: Ran well (close second to main market rival) over C&D last week when bidding for a Southwell hat-trick; remains in good form and is now 2lb lower; leading contender.

runners.name: Disclosure
runners.comment: On a reduced mark, so has a chance provided her game is raised; new yard
runners.spotlight: Steadily regressive maiden for George Boughey; sold for 1,500gns since last run; on a reduced mark, so has a chance provided her game is raised on debut for James Owen.

runners.name: Masham Moor
runners.comment: In-form 8yo who prevailed narrowly in classified contest over C&D most recently
runners.spotlight: In-form 8yo who prevailed narrowly in classified contest most recently, recording a third C&D success; competitively treated on best handicap form; in the mix.

7:45.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: King Sharja
runners.comment: Lacks recent match practice and best form remains on turf
runners.spotlight: Lacks recent match practice, having been absent since October, and best form remains on turf; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Lumenbourg
runners.comment: Sole attempt at Southwell resulted in a solid win on penultimate start
runners.spotlight: Sole attempt at Southwell resulted in solid win (beat a subsequent scorer) on penultimate outing; possibilities back here.

runners.name: American Star
runners.owner: Old Gilroyders And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on reappearance and all wins remain on turf
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival at Newcastle on reappearance and all wins remain on turf; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him last July, he ran okay for us first time out but then he was disappointing. But we're hoping that a winter break will see him return to the sort of form he showed for his last connections as a two-year-old, in which case he would be well treated. He's running at Ripon on Thursday over 6f as that was where he ran his best race for us last year. 17-04-24

runners.name: Global Warning
runners.comment: Six-time AW winner but has a question mark over current form
runners.spotlight: Six-time AW winner but has a question mark over current form; best watched unless the market speaks positively.

quotes.race: sunracing.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: Global Warning won well, I was very pleased with him. He's an improving horse, still young and on his first time against the older horses but he showed me something I like to see - when they picked up at the two and a half, he stretched all the way to the line - Gerald Mosse, jockey.

runners.name: Thanks Dad
runners.comment: Still a maiden but is capable of being involved
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but is capable of being involved; close third over C&D on penultimate start (best effort this year).

runners.name: Asadjumeirah
runners.comment: Still seeking first success over 7f and at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Largely respectable form over 6f this year features two wins at Newcastle; still seeking first success over 7f and at Southwell.

runners.name: Royal Justice
runners.comment: Beaten only 2l on stable debut but the form may not be reliable
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; beaten only 2l over C&D on stable/seasonal debut but the form may not be reliable (dictated the pace).

runners.name: Embarked
runners.comment: Inconsistent since defying a higher mark over C&D in September
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent since defying a higher mark over C&D in September; not sure what to expect.

runners.name: Match Anthem
runners.comment: Record of 11422332 since November; future mark 1lb higher; respected
runners.spotlight: Has developed into a consistent sort, having produced form figures of 11422332 since November, most recently running well at Wolverhampton last week; due to go up 1lb in future; respected.

runners.name: Fifty Sent
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but has place claims on recent 1m classified form
runners.spotlight: Record is only 1-31 but he has place claims on recent 1m classified form, which includes a close second at Southwell; refused to enter stalls in latest intended start; drops to 7f.

runners.name: Mr Slicker
runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Paul Shaw, Brendan L Jones & Andrew Hollinshead

runners.comment: Placed at Southwell six times this year; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Placed at Southwell six times this year; again has an each-way squeak but this 11yo is still seeking a first British win.

runners.name: Cubanista

prev_owners.owner: D L Bayliss & G A Libson

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival at Newcastle on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in last C&D attempt; failed to beat a rival at Newcastle on seasonal debut and is still seeking a first AW success.

4:40.race_name: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Popular Dream
runners.comment: In-form contender who has a respectable C&D record; very solid claims
runners.spotlight: In-form contender whose respectable C&D record features two wins this winter and two placed efforts, despite traffic issues, this month; very solid claims off unaltered mark.

runners.name: Hint Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Form dipped last year; market instructive on debut for new stable
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-8 for Ed Dunlop, both wins in 2023 (not in same form last term); sold for 8,000gns since last run; hood and tongue-tie fitted on return from layoff; market instructive.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C And D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wanted to take a lead but Hint Of The Jungle latched on with me and I didn't want to take him back. He battled on and stuck his head out towards the line and he's really professional - Morgan Cole, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: 60 Years Of Porsche 911 EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)(Div II)
quotes.quote: He's got a real high cruising speed. I'd upgrade Hint Of The Jungle as well because I was stuck in the middle of the track for a long way. He saw a lot of daylight the whole time and was just getting a bit lonely in front, but he's got a real good attitude. I think he'll end up being a bit better than a Beverley horse - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Havechatma
runners.comment: Successful over C&D in last three Class 6 attempts; warrants respect
runners.spotlight: Absent since defeat in higher grade seven weeks ago; successful over C&D in last three Class 6 attempts, taking Southwell record to 4-6; on a tougher mark now but still respected.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Havechatma has won previously here and Dean [Ivory, trainer] left it up to me. He said she's straightforward, just let her bounce and roll and she'll keep finding for you. She was in good order today - Grace McEntee, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Nelson Gay
runners.comment: Won in higher grade last time, taking Southwell record to 3-4; player
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-4 at Southwell includes two wins this year, latest in Class 5 contest 17 days ago; still favourably handicapped on historical data; major contender back down in grade.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: I felt justified running Nelson Gay in the Norfolk last season after he was beaten at Yarmouth, but it just didn't happen for him last year until he fell in in a bad maiden at Southwell. He won well at Wolverhampton last time, which was the first stepping stone to better things and he was very good. I didn't expect him to win eight lengths, but he's in a race at Goodwood next week or we'll go for the five-furlong handicap at Royal Ascot - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Wolverhampton last time when runner-up to Phoenix Beach. There probably weren't enough runners for him - it's better if he runs into a bit of trouble. A furlong out it looked like he had the beating of the winner but he just hesitated. I'd be half tempted to put a set of blinkers on him next time. He seems to like the all-weather but I'm not sure where we'll go next. 28-08-24

runners.name: Betweenthesticks
runners.owner: J A Swinburne & Mrs Ruth A Carr
runners.comment: Record of 1-5 for new yard, the win at Wolverhampton in October
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-5 for new stable, the win at Wolverhampton in October; below par on reappearance but may fare better with that outing under his belt; first attempt at Southwell.

runners.name: Blue Force
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.comment: Record of 21321 in AW handicaps; looks open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Lacks recent match practice but otherwise looks open to further progress, having produced form figures of 21321 in AW handicaps, most recently scoring at Newcastle in November.

runners.name: Lets Go Hugo
runners.comment: Two-time AW scorer who starts his 2025 campaign on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Two-time AW scorer who starts his 2025 campaign off a workable mark; ended last season with two below-par efforts but a return to form would put him in the picture.

runners.name: Classy Clarets
runners.comment: Gained sole success in most recent Class 6 attempt (December)
runners.spotlight: Record is only 1-18 but he gained the success in most recent Class 6 attempt, beating Nelson Gay at Wolverhampton in December; return to this grade may help.

runners.name: Jeans Maite
runners.comment: Five-time course winner who is well handicapped on best form
runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner, most recently last March; not in anything like the same form since but a revival would give her a good chance off current mark.

runners.name: Piloto Pardo
runners.comment: Chance partly depends on how well he responds to blinkers
runners.spotlight: 7f winner for previous yard; far from solid judged on his form (5f-7f) for current stable; chance partly depends on how well he responds to first-time blinkers.

stable_tour.quote: Big strong colt who got off the mark on his second start at Kempton in September. His trip will probably be a mile to a mile and a quarter and he's got plenty of ability.# 29-04-24

runners.name: Sassy Redhead
runners.comment: Weak claims on recent 5f form; all wins remain at 6f
runners.spotlight: Holds weak claims on recent 5f form and all wins remain at 6f; lost chance with a very poor start last time; comes with risk.

runners.name: Timetobenice
runners.comment: 0-11 in handicaps but has possibilities off a reduced mark dropped to Class 6
runners.spotlight: Latest defeat took his handicap record to 0-11; however, he is well treated on best form and has possibilities off a reduced mark dropped to Class 6 for first time.

runners.name: Jez Bomb
runners.comment: Progressive in September/October; beaten twice since but isn't written off
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive on AW in September/October, winning three times; unable to sustain that form in two starts since but isn't written off with Wolverhampton reappearance under his belt.

runners.name: Vixey
runners.comment: Likely player provided her recent 7f form is transferred to this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Solid record over 7f this year features a Southwell success on penultimate start when shaping as she'll be as effective back at 1m; creditable second at Newcastle latest; major contender.

runners.name: Down To The Kid

prev_owners.owner: GB Civil, N Sennett & I Furtado
Gb Civil Engineering & The Giggle Factor

runners.comment: Couple of second-place finishes over C&D since dropped back to 1m; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Three-time 1m4f winner here; has shown versatility with a couple of second-place finishes over C&D since dropped back to 1m, beaten narrowly in higher grade latest; enters calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't show much last year but hit the lids in style this year with back-to-back wins at Southwell in the spring, each time over 1m4f. He was denied his hat-trick back at our local track by a nose. He was disappointing last time but had had had a much-needed break so was always going to be better for the run. There is more to come from him as he is still relatively lightly raced. 29-08-22

runners.name: Forever Proud
runners.comment: On last winning mark; good chance provided she takes well to new headgear
runners.spotlight: Productive spell in December/January featured four wins, the most recent off this mark; placed at Chelmsford last time; good chance provided she takes well to new headgear.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Forever Proud doesn't do an awful lot when she hits the front but if something rallied I always thought she'd go again. It was a very different scenario tonight, she's been running over an extended mile at Wolverhampton - that suits her very well - and I had slight reservations about 7f round here, but she's in such a good vein of form at the moment and all credit to James [Owen, trainer] and the team, they'e got her spot on - Hector Crouch, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's been very busy. She won at Chelmsford on December 19, then was second at Wolverhampton a couple of days later and then we ran her again at Wolverhampton on December 27 before the handicapper put her up and she won again. She's always shown her best form at Lingfield and it took me a while to work out how to train her really, but we've tweaked a few things and got to the bottom of that. We're looking forward to getting her back to Lingfield in January and I think her form will step up again when she gets back there. 01-01-25

runners.name: Jack Daniel
runners.comment: Finished last of ten over C&D in sole outing for new stable
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins for previous yard; finished last of ten over C&D in sole outing for new stable; had wind surgery (his second) since; others hold stronger claims.

runners.name: Tasmanian Legend
runners.comment: Stone below last winning mark but has become inconsistent; not solid
runners.spotlight: Has become inconsistent; best effort this year when second at Wolverhampton in January; stone below last winning mark but doesn't look a particularly solid option.

runners.name: Light Up Our Stars
runners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam

prev_owners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam
Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam

runners.comment: Recent strike-rate is modest; only one win in the last 17 months
runners.spotlight: Made the frame at Wolverhampton the last twice; multiple winner down the years but recent strike-rate is modest; registered only one success in the last 17 months.

quotes.race: BJ Llewellyn Supports Tenovus Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Light Up Our Stars ran a grand race at Newbury on his seasonal comeback on very soft ground and the quick conditions here have helped him. We will have to see how the handicapper looks at the result before making a little plan - Richard Hughes, trainer.

4:07.race_name: Raymond Mills Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:07.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: Realisation
runners.comment: Below par the last twice but a case can be made on her promising form last autumn
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been at her best the last twice and made mistakes last time, while she's also untested at this trip; however, this lightly raced 3m point runner-up stayed on well when placed in the autumn on her first two chase starts (2m4f, good) and is not written off.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely mare who won her bumper nicely at Bangor in October. We have taken our time with her as she is still a very weak individual but there is clearly a motor under the bonnet. She is doing well at home and we will be looking for another bumper to win later this month and then decide if we should up her in class. I think she is very capable of stepping up in grade and, as I have said already, we have some lovely youngsters this season; she is definitely on that list. 11-01-23

runners.name: Fete Champetre
runners.comment: Running well over 2m3f/2m4f since returning from an absence; stamina in his pedigree
runners.spotlight: 10yo who is lightly raced for his age; returned from absence with fair fourth at Sedgefield (2m3f, good to soft) in December and he was in front when falling two out at Ayr (2m4f, soft) three weeks ago; there's stamina in his pedigree and he's a contender if seeing out this new trip.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Four Calling Birds Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When Fete Champetre won his novice hurdle we had quite high hopes for him but he's not quite lived up to that unfortunately. He's had his issues and Rose has been very patient with him and given him every chance, so it's great to repay that by winning on him. Rose is ill today so can't be here but she'll be watching at home cheering on -  Jockey Craig Nichol speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fete Champetre is a nice horse, he won his bumper well at Kelso and we love him. We've schooled him over loads of fences to bring him back on his hocks a bit and it's worked. He's improved a hell of a lot from his last run and I hope he'll be a three-mile chaser next year. As long as the ground is all right he could run again this season - Tony Dobbin, trainer's husband.

runners.name: Carrigeen Castle
runners.comment: Wind surgery and the return to Wetherby are possible catalysts for a necessary revival
runners.spotlight: Not at his best this season and unproven at today's trip under rules; however, he's had wind surgery since last time and won here last February and March on his two previous visits to Wetherby; not discounted.

quotes.race: Colin Hawkins (Jockey) Memorial Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We had a couple of entries in this race and were keen to run something. Carrigeen Castle looks a progressive horse. He'll probably have one more run then we'll look forward to next season with him - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Court At Slip
runners.comment: Runs off last winning mark but pulled up at Carlisle recently when back from long absence
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who has the same mark as for his win at Newcastle in December 2023; pulled up at Carlisle 19 days ago on return from long absence and, while he may have needed that run, a rapid transformation is required.

quotes.race: Living North Magazines Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I had a walk on the track earlier and I just felt like right down the inside was maybe where it was wettest so I tried to keep out in the middle. Court At Slip does whatever you want him to - if you want him come big for you he will do but if you leave him alone he's clever - William Easterby, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Roger Rarebit
runners.comment: Only 4th last time but runner-up to progressive winner previously; player if back on song
runners.spotlight: Only fourth at Haydock in January last time but goes well fresh and he was a 7l second at Warwick (3m, good to soft) in December behind one who has won twice since; trainer won this last year; player if back on song.

stable_tour.quote: He made his debut last December when third in a junior bumper at Hereford. He had to run him at the time for the benefit of his mental state. In fairness he is a big individual who was very precocious, but he'll start back over hurdles. 19-10-21

runners.name: Giovanni Change
runners.breeder: Sarl Elevage Du Haras De Bourgeauville
runners.owner: Readers & Wiggy, The 8 Amigos & J Burns
runners.comment: Some fair form at Market Rasen among recent starts but this 10yo is on a long losing run
runners.spotlight: On a reduced mark and has been a fair third at Market Rasen on two of his last three starts (3m3f, good to soft); has run well here in the past but Market Rasen brings out the best in him and this 10yo's losing sequence goes back 15 races to May 2023.

quotes.race: Victor Lucas Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Giovanni Change is just the most genuine horse you are ever going to see. He has only got one eye, that is his fifth win now, his fourth at Market Rasen. He just won on the Flat at Ponterfract, what more can you ask for- Neil Readman, co-owner, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: MansionBet #morethanthenational Faller Insurance Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Giovanni Change has run some very good races in defeat in novices and a nice break has worked a treat with him. We've always thought he's a really nice horse, he has some good novice hurdle form that stacks up and hopefully we can pick up a nice race with him - Mark Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Europe Hotel Killarney INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: We have actually had Giovanni Change a while but he's been a bit of a slow burner. He definitely wouldn't like it any quicker. I'm surprised by that and he will be a nice horse going forward for the future. The further he goes the better I'd say, and he might even make into a winter horse. I wouldn't be afraid of slower ground as he has a fair knee action - trainer Emmet Mullins.

runners.name: Heroique De Maulde
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulde
runners.comment: Back to form with close second at Newcastle (middle leg of a hat-trick for the winner)
runners.spotlight: Returned from a long absence for a new yard this season and, having dropped down the weights, he returned to form with a close second of five at Newcastle (2m7f, good) this month; that was the middle leg of a hat-trick for the winner and this fellow could be thereabouts once more.

runners.name: Mixedwave
runners.comment: He's below his last winning mark but current campaign has been somewhat underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Huntingdon early last year and he's well treated on that form; fair fifth at Doncaster on penultimate start and heavy ground may have been too much at Leicester last time, but it's been an underwhelming campaign overall and others arrive with more pressing claims.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was lovely to get back on Mixedwave. I'm very fortunate that the owners are supportive and Pam (Sly) is so loyal and a lovely lady. He's massive and not a hurdler, so when he came to chasing he soon found his form and keeps winning. He's put the race to bed nicely and has managed to stay ahead of the handicapper - Alex Edwards, rider.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Racing Bank Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mixedwave deserved that really as he was disqualified the other day although we have moved on from that. He seems to be improving with his racing and hopefully there is more to come -  Pam Sly, trainer.

runners.name: Mister Bells
runners.comment: Now 8lb lower than when winning last January but this 11yo has struggled this season
runners.spotlight: Now 8lb lower than when winning at Catterick last January but this 11yo has struggled this season; dramatic revival is required.

quotes.race: Kelly Foley O'Connor Pyne Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mister Bells has been very consistent and is in great form. I though the ground might have gone a bit against him. He levelled out and stayed to the line - Jordan Gainford, rider.

3:00.race_name: Bulloughs Cleaning Services Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: Baseline
runners.breeder: E A R L De Faydeau
runners.comment: Unplaced on recent handicap hurdle debut but could improve for the change of disciplines
runners.spotlight: Sixth of seven, beaten about 7l, on recent handicap hurdle debut at Taunton (2m, good) and he could do with settling better; however, in-form stable wastes little time in sending this lightly raced 7yo over fences and he could improve for the chance of disciplines; possible player.

runners.name: Findthetime
runners.comment: C&D winner whose mark continues to tumble but a major turnaround is required
runners.spotlight: C&D winner whose mark continues to tumble but he's been pulled up/tailed off on his last three starts and a major turnaround is required.

quotes.race: Follow @racingtv On Twitter Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Findthetime didn't behave himself at all at Sedgefield, he made a right fool of himself, so we thought we'd go again fairly quickly. He's got a special sort of earplugs in and they've done something to him, they've put him to sleep a little bit. He's always shown ability, he's won three hurdles. I think Nells Son needs a good break between races, to get him fresh. A lot of two-mile horses need to have a bit of bounce in them. I wouldn't give up on him, I still think there's a good handicap in him. He'll have a proper break and we'll get him back - Nicky Richards, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was progressive last season, winning his last three races at Sedgefield, Catterick and Wetherby, which saw his mark go up from 111 to 123. His last run was his best when he was particularly impressive. We had planned to run him at Aintree but he met with a slight injury, which put paid to those ideas. He's training very well now and hopefully will be ready to start off again in three or four weeks. We'll stick to hurdles until Christmas and then see whether we step him up to fences. 19-10-22

runners.name: Harel Du Marais
runners.comment: Made it 2-2 for yard with something to spare at Southwell; 7lb penalty may not stop him
runners.spotlight: Won on stable debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) on March 3 and followed up there 11 days ago (2m, good to soft); had nearly 5l to spare last time and a 7lb penalty may not stop this thriving 8yo.

runners.name: Rumoursareflying
runners.comment: 0-15 but he's been a fair 3rd behind rejuvenated winners the last twice; could be involved
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden (0-15) but often ran well over hurdles (including here) and he's lightly raced over fences, finishing a fair third the last twice behind rejuvenated winners (2m/2m1f, good to soft); could be involved.

runners.name: Hold Onto The Line
runners.comment: Won at Newcastle last time and it was a decent race, despite the numbers; up just 2lb
runners.spotlight: Versatile in terms of trip and posted a close third at Musselburgh last month (2m7f, good to soft; strong form for the grade) before winning a three-runner handicap at Newcastle (2m, good) a fortnight ago; it was a decent race last time, despite the numbers, and he's just 2lb higher here.

runners.name: Special Dragon
runners.comment: Something to prove over fences but has had wind op since last time and is lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on chase debut at Southwell in October and had a bit of work to do when falling three out at Newcastle later that month; however, she's had wind surgery since and this lightly raced 6yo could be in the mix if rediscovering the form shown over hurdles last spring; not discounted.

3:32.race_name: Albert Bartlett Triple Crown Series Handicap Hurdle
3:32.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: Kap Vert
runners.comment: 2m novice hurdle winner who is open to improvement now up in trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won at Exeter (2m, soft) in December on second hurdle start and has run creditably in third on both outings since (2m, soft); begins handicap life on a fair mark and this 3m point runner-up (good to yielding) is open to further improvement now up in trip; firmly in calculations.

runners.name: Jacovec Cavern
runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: 6l ahead in big field at Cork last Thursday only to fall at final flight; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Returned to form back on better ground at Cork (2m4f, good) last Thursday, when he was 6l ahead in a big field only to fall at the final flight; should be fine if good to soft ground prevails today; strong claims.

quotes.race: Gardner Mechanical Services Handicap
quotes.quote: We've been waiting all year for this ground and he's very well handicapped in these conditions. He's in the sales next week and should appeal to the jumps trainers, his brother Greystoke has won over hurdles and but Jacovec Cavern is a more athletic type and stays well - Jack Channon, trainer's son.

runners.name: Fostersisland
runners.comment: Well treated on form as recent as November but this 10yo has been patchy subsequently
runners.spotlight: Has often run well here and he's well treated on course form as recent as November; however, his subsequent form has been patchy and this 10yo needs to raise his game in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Jericoacoara
runners.owner: G R Orchard & Mrs J M Gray

prev_owners.owner: Arf Racing, Davide Satalia & Mme Michele Juhen-Cypres

runners.comment: Fair efforts on first two British starts and the step up in trip could be a positive
runners.spotlight: Listed placed in France over an extended 2m3f; fair efforts at Newcastle this year on first two British starts (2m1f, good to soft) and today's step up in trip could be a positive; not ruled out.

runners.name: Blue Hop
runners.comment: Strong form in big fields the last twice and he's a solid contender
runners.spotlight: Won in a big field when upped to 3m at Doncaster (good to soft) in January and he's since been a good second of 17 at Ascot (2m7f, good); there can be optimism that he'll be fine at this trip and he's a solid contender.

stable_tour.quote: He's just had a wind operation, which we felt would help him after last season. He won a maiden hurdle at Ayr in February and then got outpaced on good ground at Cheltenham last season but we ran him there as we want to go back there with him this season. He's entered at Doncaster on Saturday but could run at Cheltenham in a beginners' chase in December. He's been schooling very well and doing everything really nicely. He'll likely have a bit to find on ratings at Cheltenham but that's only because he's unexposed. He was always going to be a much better chaser than hurdler. 30-11-23

runners.name: Park Annonciade
runners.comment: Close third at Ayr two starts ago and heavy ground perhaps not ideal there since
runners.spotlight: Reverted to hurdles with a close third at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in January, when well backed and inconvenienced by a mistake three out; heavy ground perhaps wasn't ideal there next time; capable of a bold show.

quotes.race: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Park Annonciade was very good. He took me there easily and he jumped two out and the last superbly - Ben Bromley, jockey.

runners.name: Butlers Brief
runners.comment: 10yo who has very healthy strike-rate but returns from a break and may prefer further
runners.spotlight: Enhanced his very healthy strike-rate with win at Bangor in October; however, pulled up at Warwick in November and off since; this 10yo's last seven wins have all come over 2m7f+; others make greater appeal.

quotes.race: Make Your Mental Health A Priority Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Alastair Ralph's done a good job with Butler's Brief and his horses run well around here. He likes the track and better ground. It's nice that he's won again - Nick Scholfield, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A bit of a flagbearer for us over the years. He tried fences and it didn't work out but he's won eight races over hurdles. It will probably be his last season and we'll have a couple more runs and see how we go. There's still some improvement and hopefully a few more wins in him. 19-02-25

runners.name: Soldierofthestorm
runners.comment: Looked progressive in the first half of last year but hasn't shone this winter
runners.spotlight: Looked progressive in the first half of last year; it's too soon to write him off and he was well backed last time, but he's finished merely eighth on both outings this winter and a return to form is needed.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Proudly Supporting British Racing Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Soldierofthestorm is a lovely horse. The Bond family own him and he's a homebred, which makes this special, and we've had him since he was a foal - Jonjo O'Neill jr, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.
