runners.name: Magic Wave
runners.comment: Fair sixth of 17 here last time and today's forecast better ground may well be a plus
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 9yo who returned to some form with sixth of 17 here (2m3f, soft) last month; needs another step back in the right direction today but the forecast better ground may well be a plus (his bumper and maiden hurdle wins came on good to soft going).

runners.name: Crazierthandaisy
runners.comment: Bumper and novice hurdle winner who is in excellent hands to continue her progress
runners.spotlight: Good-ground bumper winner who has been favourite for all three hurdle starts, finishing second twice in a row (2m/2m4f, soft/good to soft) before winning in a big field at Warwick (2m5f, soft); in excellent hands to continue her progress and she's very much respected on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: She won her bumper at the second attempt at Plumpton last season. She's summered well and has come back a much kinder person altogether. She's still deeply enthusiastic but is easier to handle, which is good for her and all of us. 22-10-24

runners.name: Kilta
runners.comment: Won over hurdles and fences last spring; inconsistent over fences since his last win
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Southwell last March and fences at Cartmel last May; has dropped to a dangerous mark but he's been inconsistent over fences since that last win; reverts to hurdles and others are more compelling.

runners.name: Book Of Tales

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Two pretty good efforts this winter, after long absence, and today's new trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Three wins in the summer of 2023, two of them on the Flat and one on hurdle debut; following a long absence he's run pretty well in defeat this winter in his first two handicap hurdles (2m/1m7f, good to soft) and having won over 1m6f on the Flat he could be suited by today's step up in trip.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Acca Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: This trip will be the bare minimum for Book Of Tales but the blinkers certainly focussed his mind and he's going the right way now - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Kalhandrion
runners.breeder: Joel Denis, Clotilde De Barmon, Emmanuel
runners.comment: 5yo who is lightly raced but he was soundly beaten on last month's handicap debut
runners.spotlight: 5yo who could be suited by the likely return to better ground on this second handicap start, but he was soundly beaten when fifth of seven at 18-1 at Newbury (2m4f, soft) last month and others appeal more.

2:30.race_name: Thank You & Good Luck Charlo' Selling Hurdle
2:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: Honneur Dajonc
runners.comment: Useful hurdler and smart chaser but unpredictable now; back to form latest; form chance
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler with smart chase form in 2022-23 but unpredictable now and form has wavered since Fontwell win (2m1f, good to soft) for this yard in September; fared better when a close second in a Catterick claimer (1m7f, good; first-time visor) this month; form chance on a going day.

quotes.race: AK Bets Watch All UK Racing Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Honneur d'Ajonc is quite quirky and it's taken a while to get him where he is today. He doesn't like being crowded and didn't enjoy being boxed in on the rails at Perth last time. Today he's had the dream run round - Alex Chadwick, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Tribute Cornwall Pale Ale Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought we'd lost Honneur D'Ajonc at Kempton last season and it took a long time for him to recover from that, so it's very rewarding to see him going the right way now. He's a proper horse and exactly what we thought he was going to be. This would have been the limit of his stamina but he's versatile and has grown over the last year - Jane Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at Doncaster in the spring. He's won for us and ran very well the other day on heavy ground at Haydock over 2m3f, which is good as it opens up more avenues. I think he'll stay further. New owners at my yard have got involved with him and they've purchased another horse recently, so they're having a good bit of fun. 01-01-25

runners.name: Wolfspear
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late John Harrington
runners.comment: Three wins from 8 handicap completions at 2m4f and 2m2f; back to form latest; a contender
runners.spotlight: Three wins from eight handicap completions, at 2m4f and 2m2f (ground ranging from good to heavy); below best since back from a break but there was more promise in his latest run at Stratford and he may have a better chance than the weights suggest.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We knew Woldspear was fit and well but he'd had so long [493 days] off the track and some of these horses take time to get going again. He ran well and was full of running at the end. I was pleased so hopefully he can come on for it and win more races - Oliver Boyden, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won very well on his debut at Huntingdon. The form has worked out well and the runner-up, First Street, has won twice over hurdles. He'll start off in a maiden hurdle in two or three weeks. 21-10-21

runners.name: Benito
runners.breeder: Erick Bec De La Motte & F Cottin

prev_owners.owner: George Houghton And Mrs E J Quinlan

runners.comment: Two hurdle wins in 2022; very modest form since absence; weights are all against him
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle wins off modest marks in 2022 but he's shown very ordinary form since back from an absence and has much to find at the weights.

runners.name: Tamar Bridge

prev_owners.owner: McNeill Family and Prodec Networks Ltd

runners.comment: Very useful at best; ran well back from absence; not so good since; big chance at weights
runners.spotlight: Very useful at best but pulled up in all three starts in 2022 then went missing for nearly two years; showed there was plenty left in him when runner-up at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) in October but he didn't convince at Lingfield in December; ought to be a huge factor here.

quotes.race: Unibet - 2021 Horserace Betting Operator Of The Year Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was tough for Tamar Bridge first time against seasoned handicappers, but he's an out-and-out stayer. He's a good horse and will make a lovely chaser in time - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Play New Slots Weekly At Betfair Casino "Newcomers" Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tamar Bridge is a big, fine horse whose future lies over further. He loved that ground and showed a good attitude - Aidan Coleman, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He left his season behind after a hard race when he won at Aintree last December. The plan is to go chasing now and he's freshened up, jumps a fence well and is hopefully going to make up into a really nice staying handicap chaser. He's ready to start and will go as soon as the rain comes as he'll need the soft ground. 27-10-22

He won his first two races this season, at Wetherby and Aintree, and in retrospect I was wrong to send him to Cheltenham in search of his hat-trick. He is on a mark only 6lb higher than his last success so I hope he can win again this season. He has the makings of a lovely chaser next season as he looks the part. 26-01-22

2:00.race_name: #WearAHatDay Supporting Brain Tumour Awareness Month Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: All Well And Good
runners.comment: Bumper winner who makes hurdle debut in a race lacking depth; firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: Won the second of his three bumpers (all 2m on good) and runner-up in the other two (2m, good); makes hurdle debut in a race lacking depth and he's a major player if fully tuned up on first run since last September.

runners.name: Jasmin Bellevue
runners.comment: Yet to shine under rules but this point runner-up is in top hands and capable of better
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on hurdle debut at Ascot (2m5f, good to soft; albeit a warm race) and unseated mid-race at Hereford (2m3f, good) three weeks ago; however, the drop in trip could suit this headstrong point runner-up, who is in top hands (yard also runs Katana) and should appreciate this left-handed track; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He was second in the last of his two point-to-points in May 2023, but he had problems last season and didn't run. I hope these have been ironed out. He's coming along nicely now and has loads of size and scope. 22-10-24

runners.name: Katana
runners.comment: Yet to threaten but could take a sizeable step forward at some stage for leading trainer
runners.spotlight: Unable to threaten on either start when fifth in a bumper at Wincanton (1m7f, good) then 29l sixth over hurdles at Taunton (2m3f, good to soft); however, he's with a leading trainer (one of two for the yard) and could take a sizeable step forward at some stage.

runners.name: Kids Say Lastgojoe
runners.breeder: Emmanuel Rocton, Bruno Bertin & Alsin Co
runners.comment: Bumper winner; well beaten on hurdle debut but wind op since and not written off
runners.spotlight: Easily made all in Catterick bumper (1m7f, good) in November on second start; the strength of that form is questionable and he was well beaten on hurdle debut at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft) in January, but he's had wind surgery since and is not written off.

runners.name: Kit The Christian
runners.comment: There's potential in his pedigree but he was tailed off at 100-1 on last month's debut
runners.spotlight: There's potential in his pedigree but he was tailed off at 100-1 on last month's debut at Doncaster and is probably best watched for now.

runners.name: Mythical

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Tailed off/pulled up at triple-figure odds this winter on his first three hurdle starts
runners.spotlight: Regressive on the Flat and tailed off/pulled up at triple-figure odds this winter on his first three hurdle starts.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Mythical is a beautiful horse. He's probably a very good horse but he's still very raw - Donnacha O'Brien, rider.

runners.name: Regal Cavalier
runners.comment: Won on the Flat in France last June by 5l; interesting contender on hurdle/stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat at Corlay (1m7f, soft) in France last June on his second run; had 5l to spare and changed hands for 21,000euros last July; absent since but he's an interesting contender on his hurdle and stable debut.

runners.name: Sleeping Late
runners.comment: Has made the frame on both starts and has the best hurdle form in the line-up; respected
runners.spotlight: Has shown some promise when making the frame on his first two starts (2m, good to soft/good); his form isn't overly strong but it's better than any of the others have achieved over hurdles; respected.

runners.name: Solent Gateway
runners.comment: Yet to transfer his Flat ability to hurdles but wind op could help; possible player
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat; unable to transfer that ability to hurdles this winter on his first two attempts but he's had wind surgery since and could have lots more to offer in this code; possible player.

quotes.race: Betfred TV Hell Nook Handicap
quotes.quote: I knew Solent Gateway quite well because I've ridden against him a few times and I just did what I was told by the boss. I got an easy lead. I cantered round in front, he was a relaxed horse and he was very push-button - Hollie Doyle, rider.

quotes.race: tote+ Chester Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Solent Gateway never relaxed but he needs to be held up really and you can't do it in a race like that. He'll learn - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a handful of runs for me when I first arrived before we decided he might benefit from wind surgery. It certainly didn't do him any harm as he has added victories at Wolverhampton and Haydock to his CV. Last time out at Newbury he ran another fine race when fourth to Sweet William, who more than franked the form at Glorious Goodwood. Solent Gateway now heads to York next week and the flat, galloping 2m will be ideal for him. He's a tough and consistent individual who always runs his race. The flipside to that honesty is that he's not particularly well handicapped. 17-08-23

runners.name: Brindley
runners.comment: Failed to settle and tailed off at 50-1 on recent hurdle and stable debut at Huntingdon
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden on the Flat at up to 1m; however, he failed to settle and was tailed off at 50-1 on recent hurdle and stable debut at Huntingdon.

stable_tour.quote: He's come to us off the Flat, where he cost a lot of money. He looks like a hurdler and will probably run at the end of January. He seems a nice type. 11-12-24

runners.name: Cap Ricochet
runners.comment: Has shown some ability but improvement is needed; wayward when unseating early last time
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability but improvement is needed and he was wayward before unseating early at Sedgefield last week on his second hurdle start.

runners.name: Sir Galahad

prev_owners.owner: T A Rahman, S Siddiqui, R Gray & Partner

runners.comment: Fair maiden on the Flat; has joined a good yard for hurdle career (one of two for stable)
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden on the Flat for James Ferguson at up to 1m4f; changed hands for 25,000gns last July and this is his first run since; has joined a good yard for his hurdle career and could have a bright future in this code; one of two for the stable and a market check is advised.

runners.name: Dillys Gunner
runners.comment: Runner-up here in the first of her two bumpers; not ruled out each-way on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in bumper here (2m, soft) in December; failed to build on that when fifth at Catterick (1m7f, good to soft) in January but this half-sister to connections' useful hurdler Sam's Gunner is not ruled out each-way on her first hurdle start.

4:45.race_name: 100% RacingTV Profits Back To Racing Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
4:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: Marmalade Time
runners.comment: Won a novice hurdle at Doncaster last March but has struggled in handicaps since
runners.spotlight: Won a novice hurdle at Doncaster last March but has struggled to get competitive in handicaps since (five attempts); needs to raise her game.

quotes.race: aceodds.com Bonus Codes EBF Mares' 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: I think the ground was the key, Marmalade Time wouldn't necessarily have a massive turn of foot at the end of a race but she just keeps galloping. So it played right into her hands today. She's still quite green but she's improved run by run - Mel Rowley, trainer.

runners.name: Ballin Bay

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.comment: Won over hurdles for Pauline Robson; not ruled out on first run for Rebecca Menzies
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles for Pauline Robson at Kelso in November 2023 and didn't run badly over fences at Sedgefield when last seen in December 2024, following six months off; not ruled out back hurdling on first run for Rebecca Menzies.

runners.name: Henrysbrotherjack
runners.comment: Wins on soft and heavy ground this winter; strong claims if handling today's surface
runners.spotlight: Won when upped to 2m4f at Uttoxeter (soft) in December on third handicap start and bounced back from Market Rasen fifth (2m4f, good to soft) to win at Bangor (2m7f, heavy) last time; this unexposed 6yo has strong claims if today's forecast better ground isn't an issue.

runners.name: Snowrocco
runners.comment: Fair fourth on second handicap start and kicked at the start when well beaten last time
runners.spotlight: Finished third in a 3m point (soft) and she was a fair fourth of 18 at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in January on her second handicap start; well beaten over this C&D (soft) since but was kicked at the start; wears a first-time tongue-tie and this lightly raced 6yo is not written off.

runners.name: Glory Hights
runners.comment: Won at Carlisle in November and went very close at Ayr three weeks ago; key player
runners.spotlight: Won at Carlisle (3m, good to soft) in November when back from a break and has continued in good heart, going very close in a big field at Ayr (3m, soft) three weeks ago; every chance he'll be bang there once more.

runners.name: Aazza
runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D ten days ago off this career-low mark; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and winless over the last two seasons but she was a creditable second over C&D (good) ten days ago off this career-low mark; in the mix if backing up that performance with another good run.

runners.name: Balkotic
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant & J Le Roux
runners.comment: Reduced mark appeals on form as recent as last June but he's struggled on his 5 runs since
runners.spotlight: His reduced mark appeals on form as recent as last June but he's struggled on his five runs since; a major turnaround is needed.

runners.name: Myfavouritesister
runners.comment: Close relation to classy staying chaser The Real Whacker; could improve now up in trip
runners.spotlight: Hasn't achieved much in three bumpers or three maiden/novice hurdles, but she made late headway when fifth of seven at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) in November and this close relation to the stable's Charlie Hall winner The Real Whacker is open to improvement now up in trip on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: She's not straightforward but we're getting there with her. She's just taken a few runs to get the hang of it. She was a bit eager but is starting to relax. We're going to put a hood on her to calm her a little bit. 11-12-24

runners.name: On We Go

prev_owners.owner: Kenny Johnson And Mrs K Elliott

runners.comment: 12yo who has struggled this season; hopes pinned on wind op prompting a dramatic revival
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner who was a fair third at Sedgefield last February; however, she's struggled this season and remains winless since February 2023; hopes are pinned on wind op prompting a dramatic revival.

runners.name: Angus De Bull
runners.comment: Check betting now he's up in trip but this maiden is hard to fancy from 12lb out of h'cap
runners.spotlight: He's one to watch in the betting now up in trip but this maiden is hard to fancy from 12lb out of the handicap.

5:50.race_name: wetherbyracing.co.uk Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
5:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: Fanny Moon
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Haie Neuve
runners.comment: Dam half-sister to useful French jumper; yard's other runner Parliamo looks more likely
runners.spotlight: 16,000euros yearling; dam French maiden, half-sister to useful French jumper Benefique; yard's other runner Parliamo looks more likely.

runners.name: Jimmy Hurdstrom
runners.comment: Won sole point but was toiling from a long way out in Chepstow bumper in November
runners.spotlight: Won his only point but he dropped out in a Chepstow bumper when making his yard debut; still has potential but too much to prove today.

runners.name: Mondouiboy
runners.comment: Irish point 2nd worked out well; good bumper debut for new yard; strong contender
runners.spotlight: Smart Irish point form when chasing home one who's now on a mark of 130, with promising subsequent winners behind; his Sandown bumper debut (heavy) for this yard in February was a useful effort too and he's a strong contender for yard with a good strike-rate in bumpers (9-35).

runners.name: Ned Hill
runners.comment: 170,000euros 3yo; promising debut 4th over C&D; type to improve; yard in fine form
runners.spotlight: 170,000euros 3yo; had wind surgery and was tongue tied for debut here in February when he didn't get the best of runs but kept on steadily into fourth; the bare form needs improving on but he's a scopey type who should step forward for yard in fine form.

runners.name: Parliamo
runners.comment: Showed up well for a long way in Chepstow bumper on debut; has more on his plate today
runners.spotlight: 11-2, showed up well for a long way in a Chepstow bumper (soft) in February; should know more this time but plenty on his plate today.

runners.name: Starmount
runners.comment: Half-brother to classy jumper Stage Star; Irish point winner; in the mix on bumper debut
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Stage Star (bumper/high-class 2m3f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and La Malmason (useful 2m4f hurdle/chase); dam Grade 2-winning hurdler at 2m7f; fell late on Irish point debut but made no mistake next time; sold for Â£82,000 soon after; yard has solid strike-rate in bumpers; in the mix.

runners.name: Wandering Ego
runners.comment: Showed promise in bumpers at Newbury and Huntingdon; place prospects
runners.spotlight: Two promising efforts in bumpers, having a stiff task behind a high-class winner at Newbury (good) and bumping into an above-average Skelton newcomer at Huntingdon (good to soft); one of the more likely ones.

runners.name: Girlfromtheglen
runners.comment: Good winners among dam's siblings; runner-up in sole Irish point; market can guide
runners.spotlight: Unraced dam's siblings include useful Morning Royalty (bumper and hurdle/chase) and bumper and hurdle/chase winner Morning Supreme; runner-up in sole Irish point; sold on for Â£35,000; trainer normally does well in bumpers (2-7 here) but 0-26 in them this season; market can guide.

runners.name: Just Edith
runners.owner: Mrs Elaine Holmes & J R Norton Ltd
runners.comment: Out of winning staying hurdler; yard doesn't target these races; others more likely
runners.spotlight: Out of a 3m/3m1f hurdle winner; trainer doesn't target these races and other runners are more likely.

runners.name: Just Jane
runners.comment: 66-1 for debut here in November when dropping right out after making the running
runners.spotlight: 66-1 for her bumper debut here in November, when dropping right out after making the running.

runners.name: Dollars Dream
runners.comment: 14,000euros yearling; useful Flat pedigree; yard has few bumper runners (one winner)
runners.spotlight: 14,000euros yearling; has a useful Flat pedigree but yard has few bumper runners (one winner) and he's likely best watched.

runners.name: Habton Cup
runners.comment: Fourth in a recent point bumper; this looks a daunting task
runners.spotlight: Â£6,500 yearling; dam bred several winners, including Spider's Bite (bumper/useful 3m hurdle); it's hard to weigh up the value of his fourth in a recent point bumper and this looks a daunting task; now tongue tied.

runners.name: Dartmouth Star
runners.comment: Gets all the allowances but this is a tough start to her career
runners.spotlight: Out of a winning pointer who won at 2m-2m7f over hurdles/fences; gets all the allowances but this is a tough start to her career.

runners.name: Telepieces
runners.comment: Fairly easy to back and dropped right out on Market Rasen debut last month
runners.spotlight: Yard gets its share of bumper winners but this 4yo was fairly easy to back and dropped out on Market Rasen debut last month.

5:20.race_name: 100% RacingTV Profits Back To Racing Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
5:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (Rail Movements: 2.00 & 5.50 -12yds, 2.30 & 3.32 +30yds, 3.00 +60yds, 4.07 +120yds and 4.45 & 5.20 -24yds)

runners.name: Chatshow Host
runners.comment: Has been out of form but perhaps a wind op will prompt a revival now she's back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on handicap hurdle debut last May and struggled last month on first two chase starts; however, she showed promise in novice hurdles last year and perhaps a wind op will prompt a revival now she's back hurdling.

runners.name: Vengaboy
runners.comment: Lightly raced but down the field on both runs this year after missing all of 2024
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo for whom it's early days with this yard and he's one to watch in the betting; however, he's finished down the field on both runs this year, after missing all of 2024, and he has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Lathan
runners.comment: Fair fifth at Newcastle this month and open to improvement now up in trip; possible player
runners.spotlight: Returned from a break with a fair fifth at Newcastle (2m4f, good) this month on his second handicap start; this lightly raced half-brother to Scottish National winner Macdermott is open to improvement now up in trip and he's a possible player in first-time cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to the Scottish National winner Macdermott and, although he was very green first time out over hurdles, he shows loads of ability and looks a future chaser. He had a very good summer break and has undoubtedly improved for it. 16-10-24

runners.name: Upfordebate
runners.comment: Won at Ayr last month; only sixth since but retains potential, especially now up in trip
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well to win in a first-time tongue-tie (retained since) at Ayr (2m4f, soft) last month; only sixth at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) a fortnight later but this lightly raced 6yo retains potential, especially now up in trip (half-brother to useful stayer Duke Of Deception).

stable_tour.quote: We've been waiting for soft ground for him. He'd been running okay on good ground but needs a trip on soft going. There are a lot of handicap hurdle options coming for him now. 11-12-24

runners.name: Hawkseye View

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D Walton & D G Pryde

runners.comment: 0-14 but in fair form in chases despite jumping lacking fluency; could be firmly involved
runners.spotlight: Point winner who is 0-14 under rules; however, he's been a fair third over fences at Newcastle (2m4f/2m7f, good/good to soft) the last twice despite his jumping not being great, and he could be firmly involved if finding greater fluency now back over hurdles.

runners.name: Rumble B
runners.comment: Back to form when second at Catterick last month and could again be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 11yo who won three times in the first half of last year (including on good ground) and returned to form when second at Catterick (3m1f, good to soft) last month; could again be thereabouts.

runners.name: Foreva Alfie
runners.comment: Lightly raced but pulled up on handicap debut at Doncaster in January; headgear goes on
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who wears first-time headgear and his pedigree hints this step up in trip may suit; however, pulled up at 33-1 on handicap debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) in January; hard to be confident.

runners.name: Queen Of Steel
runners.comment: Easy win at Ffos Las last week; tackles new trip today but escapes a penalty for last time
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Ffos Las (2m4f, good) last Friday on her second stable start; she's unraced beyond that trip but drew clear to do it very easily last week and escapes a penalty, so will be very tough to beat if seeing out the distance.

runners.name: Prince Nino
runners.comment: Went close in January but unproven at this longer trip and below par the last twice
runners.spotlight: Went close to snapping a losing sequence at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in January; not a forlorn hope but he's unproven at this longer trip and hasn't been at his best the last twice.

quotes.race: Bet During The Race With BetVictor Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Prince Nino is a big horse and needs a big galloping track, so we came back here and he's run brilliantly again. There's a race for him at the next meeting, so hopefully we'll aim for that - Lizzie Quinlan, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.
